Reviews.Title: “A great deal - Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: gatortail
Reviews.Content: A very good hotel with nice rooms. Shower was nice. Our room was not very small, I can not complain. The hotel in centrally located, however I would have liked to be a little closer to the Spanish Steps. Breakfast was included in our deal and was great. The drinks in the small fridge of the room were also included. We were welcomed to the hotel with great-tasting espresso and cappuccino. My wife and I are walkers, therefore we hardly used any motorized transportation. We were able to walk everywhere and back most of the time. But what made the difference and made this review five stars is the customer-centric staff of the hotel. Hospitality Manager Simona Rongione was very helpful in every phase of our stay. She was very patient and offered a lot of helpful information and recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for better”
Reviews.Author: kevinw1957
Reviews.Content: Sometimes when you are looking for a hotel to stay in, you sit and look at pages and pages of places on the Internet and sometimes, one just jumps off the page. Such was the case with the Hotel Britannia. Some of the reviews mention that the rooms are small and that is undeniably true, but they are extremely comfortable, clean and everything works just as it should. Our bed was a little on the hard side of firm, but that seems to be usual for Italy. The hotel arranged a transfer from the airport for us and our driver was there waiting for us (collar and tie job) with a Mercedes E300 for just 10 euros more than the standard taxi fare - and a lot less hassle. Reception at the hotel was like we were old time friends - offered a drink while our bags were taken to our room - the sort of small detail that is just so rare. It is very obvious that this is a family run business that takes a pride in what it does and cares for its customers. All the staff spoke fluent English (and from what we overheard, plenty of other languages as well). Other than an Italian accent, some of them you would think were native English speakers. Recommendations for dinner were freely available and good - even a phone call to check there would be room and to expect us. Breakfast was a huge spread - hot eggs and bacon, cold meat, cheese, cereals, breads, etc and fresh fruit. Really nice coffee too and (shock, horror!) English tea. Location is pretty good too, an easy walk to Termini station or Piazza Republicca (metro at both) and all the tour buses start nearby. We were very pleased with our choice, having booked and prepaid for a week it could have gone badly wrong, but worked out perfectly. If you are looking for a friendly and characterful hotel, you won't go far wrong. We thoroughly enjoyed our week and would have no hesitation in recommending and our first choice if we go back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect Hotel in a good location with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Mad-dog-71
Reviews.Content: Hotel Britannia is a great hotel ideally located for anyone wishing to visit Rome. It's location is excellent down a small quite street less than a minutes walk to the main road Via Nationale where you can catch a bus or metro. It's only a 10 min walk from Rome' s Termini main train and bus station so it's easy to get to from the airport. The hotel is well within easy walking distance of all the main sites in Rome and even the Vatican is only 15 mins by metro. As for the hotel you could not ask for more. The room we had was furnished with everything you need and expect from a 4 star hotel including a free mini bar that was re-stocked every day with water, beer and soft drinks. Our ensuite bathroom was all marble and clean and the shower was excellent. The decor of the room was in a grand style with a large chandelier hanging from the high ceiling. The breakfast is superb with a wide choice of all the usual fresh fruits, cereal, pastries and yogurts. Also there is bacon, eggs and sausage and various other hot options as well as the usual tea coffee and various fruit juices. You won't be hungry this is a well appointed breakfast. The other great point about this hotel is the fantastic staff, a special thank you to Simona who took the time to speak to all her guests with advice and help on Rome. This hotel makes you feel like your at home, safe and comfortable and would certainly recommend it to anyone wishing to have a fantastic time in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Top class hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Deirdre E
Reviews.Content: Home away from home with very friendly staff. All spoke excellent English and helped us pick up a tiny bit of Italian. Great breakfasts - including good selection of lovely hot food. Very close to the main terminal for metro, bus and rail but in a quiet side street with a truely Roman feel. Your first stop to make friends in Rome! John E and family

Reviews.Title: “Superb location and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Susan T
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay in this very comfortable and well-appointed hotel was made particlularly memorable thanks to the extremely helpful, hospitable and efficient staff. When we experienced a baggage mix-up at the bus station (nothing to do with the hotel) the hotel staff went out of their way to sort out the problem for us, while insisting that we carry on as normal with our sight-seeing. We can't thank them enough for their warmth and generosity. Over and above the service, the hotel is ideally located for getting around Rome (by metro or on foot) - and the breakfast was great too!

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jane L
Reviews.Content: We never normally write reviews but we had to recommend this particular hotel. We would like to compliment Simona and the staff of Hotel Britannia for their excellent hospitality and service during our recent trip to Rome. The hotel was beautiful and the staff were so helpful and kind. They went over and above to ensure we had a fantastic holiday. This was an extra special holiday for us as we got engaged they ensured the small details were looked after, We could not recommend this hotel enough and we will be back. Thanks again for making it such a memorable holiday in Rome. Jane and Keith

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, delightful staff!”
Reviews.Author: Hazerella
Reviews.Content: We were extremely impressed with all aspects of the hotel. The staff were delightful, friendly and so helpful (especially Simona and Marco), they really made the stay so enjoyable, The room was very tastefully decorated, really clean and there were nice touches like a free soft drinks minibar, a sweet on your pillow at night and a rubber duck as a gift in the bathroom! The breakfast was excellent and great choice of pastries, fruit, cereal and some hot options- eggs and toast etc. The location was very near to the metro and Termini train station. We would go back there without question.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Arild54
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights in the beginning of March. The hotel has a very good situation few steps from the bus stop and a short walk from Termini. The room was very nice with a free mini bar. The cleaning of the room was perfect. When we where out eating in the evening the room was cleaned up again. The breakfast was perfect. Simona and the rest of the staff was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice small hotel and neat”
Reviews.Author: Shutterloose
Reviews.Content: Good location and easy access to public transportation. Friendly and helpful staff. They provide sumptuos breakfast. Excellent for a short stay

Reviews.Title: “a real gem...”
Reviews.Author: lovespainYork
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights staying at this lovely little hotel.Very clean room. with comfy beds. Enjoyed the little touches like the well-stocked free mini-bar, kettle(with earl grey t-bags).The balcony was great and would be fantastic for breakfast in warmer weather. All the staff were pleasant and helpful especially Simona who was keen to get feedback on service to make sure standards are kept up.They are! The location was perfect-easy to walk to main sites and getting buses was simple too.I would use this hotel on any further visits to the wonderful city of Rome and will reccommend it to family and friends. if you are coming before April 29th- ask Simona about the Steve McCurry photography exhibition and make an effort to go and see it NOT TO BE MISSED.

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: george d
Reviews.Content: - Very ''warm'' hotel with the best crew! Everyone who was working for this hotel was kind and polite . The receptionists were always helpfull . The room was perfect and extremely clean and the bathroom was very big and always warm (it also had tv) . P.S. the breakfast was awesome .. it had everything .. - It has no restaurant .

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful find”
Reviews.Author: Giovanna H
Reviews.Content: It is a lovely hotel, very close to Termini, so travelling around Rome is very easy and cheap; the staff is very friendly and nothing is too much trouble. The rooms are not huge but good value for a capital city given its location, very clean and well equiped. Some good 'local' restaurants in the area, I would certainly recommend this to any of my friends staying in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel and a unique and lovely experience”
Reviews.Author: easytrav2010
Reviews.Content: Recently spent two nights at Hotel Britannia in Rome. Our room was lovely (not huge but charming and preferable to a large unattractive room), the location is fabulous, and the bath/shower was the best we found in Italy - and it included a rubber ducky. The staff is helpful and friendly, the hotel is clean and very well-maintained, and I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rose M
Reviews.Content: A small, beautiful hotel with good service. Its location is very good as it is close to the metro, and is in walking distance to many important sites.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel :)))))”
Reviews.Author: Julia L
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff (a special receptionist MARIO and hospitality service manager Simona) were just AMAZING, helpful, friendly and very nice rooms!!! Breakfast was tasty and wide assortiment. Julia and Leif ......

Reviews.Title: “A super hotel”
Reviews.Author: Samuel382
Reviews.Content: A very reasonably priced, four star hotel 15 minutes' walk from the historic centre of Rome. The staff are welcoming and helpful and the attention to detail, both in the communal areas and in the rooms, is impressive. The buffet breakfast is another strong point. In short, this is a hotel which wants to make its guests happy - not something one can always say!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay :)”
Reviews.Author: Shannon H
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were just lovely and very welcoming and the rooms were very nice! The bathroom had a solar lamp in it, which was cool :) Breakfast was delicious every morning (very nice pastries). Only complaint (and it didn't even bother us that much) was that there was only 3 english channels on the TV, with 2 of them being news and one being movies (and only if the orginal move was in English!), and no choice for anything but the tv channels. But like I said, it didn't bother us that much as we were mostly exploring Rome :)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect staff, they run the hotel in perfection..”
Reviews.Author: zuiveld
Reviews.Content: As you enter the hotel you receive a warm welcome by Simona who is polite, beautiful and very knowledgeable and makes you feel home immediately! All the staff is.. better than perfect!  As the hotel name suggests the decoration is very British, the rooms are small but they have everything, repeat *everything* you might want! Good breakfast with very friendly service. Mario also deserves a Particular ment.. If you run into any kind of trouble he is the man to contact!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy hotel in Rome LarPaws”
Reviews.Author: Robert C
Reviews.Content: Hotel Britannia is centerally located in Rome and very clean. Very good breakfast in the morning...wide variety. Carmen was wonderful. Mario was very accomodating and worked with us on transportation needs. These two people made the experience such that we will go back to this hotel on our next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel at a convinient location”
Reviews.Author: sandeep70
Reviews.Content: The hotel was good.it was close to the metro stations as well as central to various sightseeing locations. We had a non-smoking room but the room smelled. i brought it to the notice of the manager but he said that perhaps someone has smoked in the room before. they could not change the room for me which wasn't really helpful. other than that the rooms were good, the street peaceful and the decor good.

Reviews.Title: “Sheila C”
Reviews.Author: Sheila C
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay of four nights. Hotel is so convenient for the Termini station, still in walking distance of all the main sights in Rome, but is situated in a quieter side street. The hotel is very comfortable and the breakfasts are very good. The Manager and staff are very friendly and all spoke English. Mario, at reception, was extremely helpful and sorted out trips and timings for us. We would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel next to the English Church”
Reviews.Author: William M
Reviews.Content: Very good service at this small hotel within walking distance of the main train station. Concierge was unusually good in recommending places to visit and eat.

Reviews.Title: “Almost ticked all boxes!”
Reviews.Author: JChua
Reviews.Content: Having been to Rome more than 6 times, and staying at a B & B, various 4 and 5 star hotels, this 4 star hotel near the Termini had ticked almost all boxes for us. I usually would avoid staying around the train station area, but wanting to join a tour of the Tivoli & Hadrian's Villa the next day, prompted me to stay near the Termini. Upon a short 38 minutes train ride from Orte, we simply stroll in front of the Termini station, turning on the 3rd left turn, ie on Via Viminale. Then, its walking straight on, turning on our 4th right, ie Via Napoli. The charming boutique Hotel Britannia is on our right. Having reserved the roof top Junior suite, room 403, purportedly the largest room in the Hotel, we were offered cookies, tea and drinks as complimentary from the charming, Carmen. As it was 9am, our suite wasn't ready, so off we go to shop for handicrafts. Taxi ranks are nearby on the Piazza della Republicca or check if they are queueing for customers at the nearby Hotel Quirinale (esp. after siesta, at around 3-4pm). Fortunately, we did our shopping on a Friday as the next day, Rome was paralyzed by strikes - roads were closed and there were lots of policemen standing guard. Back to our suite, on first look, I was a tad disappointed by its size as online pictures had made it look bigger. However, once in it for sometime, you will realize that it is indeed quite spacious and very comfortable. The icing on the cake has to be its private terrace (with furniture) as well as a fully marble bathroom with jacuzzi tub. Even in mid October, there were two air-con units in the suite, both functioning quite well! Everything in the suite worked - bed was comfy but its left side (facing the terrace) is a little sagged, not too bad though; lots of storage space; medium sized flat screen TV with English channels; ironing board (iron must be requested from Reception and we didn't bother); ironing press; water boiler with free tea and coffee bags; safe; free Wifi near the door (great as we have our Ipad with us); free Wine from our package; fruits in the corridor; turn down service with next day's weather forecast etc. And what amazes me was, the breakfast next morning. Served in a frescoed area as well as the charming English bar area, food was both varied and delicious! You not only get scrambled eggs, bacon, lots of melon and pineapple, you also get the rarely seen Italian ommelete and fresh mushrooms - YUMMY! The 3 staff that we had encountered was all genuinely helpful and nice, Carmen, Maddalena and Enrico. Even the housekeeping and an old gentleman who helps with our luggage were all super friendly Though there was slight renovation works at an ancient palazzo next door (October, 2011) we were not bothered by noise as the suite was set back a little from the front and onto the side of the Hotel's small parking lot. Needless to say, we slept blissfully well during our two nights there. Two small glitches here - the interior sound proofing between rooms and its corridors leaves much to be desired! Parents, if you are travelling with your kids, please ask them not to sing at 10.30pm! Another would be an Italian thingy - pillows are hopelessly flat! Always have to add one or two layers of bath towels underneath it. Overall, if not for its location further away from what Rome has to offer, this charming Hotel actually would be our frequent place to stay in Rome. But fret not, as a walk to the Spanish steps via a short cut is only about 15-20 minutes, or simply 6.50 euros by cab. Enjoy this charming and good value Boutique hotel near the Termini in Rome. It is indeed a solid 4 stars, no doubt about it, but do book at least a Superior room here as they might come with small terraces, eg room 402. Taxi transfer to the airport in a large van like vehicle was 50 euros. Arranged through the Hotel's Signore Enrico, it was both on time and efficient. Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Muffinyvonne
Reviews.Content: I booked Hotel Britannia based on the reviews in Tripadvisor and it was a wonderful choice. The hotel is within walking distance from most of the major attraction, Roman Forum, Colosseum, the Pantheon. It is located just off the main road in a quite alley which was surprisingly quite during night time. The hotel staff were helpful and friendly. We arrived early in the morning and had to drop off our luggage at the hotel first. We were offered a fresh glass of juice and some very strong italian coffee. Although the lobby is a bit small for the 6 of us to open our luggage and change gears for our city tour, the staff was very accommodating and had arranged to store our luggage safely before our rooms were ready. Francesca, of the reservation department is friendly and professional. She offered tips for our city tour although we had done most of the research. It was still genuinely appreciated as it could be a problem in Italy when most of the population still don't speak English. Wifi is a bit of challenge because each log-in password provided can be used by one machine (but we later found out it is quite common in Europe), however, the hotel had no issue providing more log-in to us. I will definitely recommend the hotel again and will also stay there again in future.

Reviews.Title: “small and smokey”
Reviews.Author: doctorj6
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from Rome and had booked 4 nights at the Britannia. The hotel has some steps down to reception not handicapped friendly. The elevator is the smallest I have ever seen anbd in the morning it is very hard to get down from the room to the breakfast area. The real problem was the smoke. Thay claim to have no smoking rooms but this is not true. The no smoking rooms have ashtrays and signs askong that you not smoke in bed. The halls reeked of smoke and the rooms smelled as well. We were told that the ashtrays were for paper waste. Really? They think we are really stupid to believe that. This is a 4 star hotel but I think it is on a scale of 10. The rooms are so small we could not open our 2 suitcases. This is a place to avoid especially considering the number of hotels in the immediate area that are superior

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: DESHS
Reviews.Content: The hotel list may services and gimmes , however they are inconsistently provided. Turn down 2 out of 5 mights, New (computer print out) 2 out of 5 nights. As other travelers have noted, their breakfast offering was the best we had on our trip. The beds where board like hard and where only fully made the day we arrived , they removed the spread and throw pillows evening one never to return, Rooms where about 8 x 10, bathroom so small only one person could be in it at a time Over all not worth the money

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: TobyK123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Britannia in September, 2011. The staff was excellent. Very polite, friendly and helpful. None of us knew any Italian. The rooms were small, but comfortable. We had verandas with a table and chairs. The TV had BBC and CNN. Location is excellent. Breakfast was excellent and the food staff were extremely attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Britannia,Rome”
Reviews.Author: Joyce M
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located within a good walking distance of ruins,collision,monuments,and some shopping. Rooms are nicely decorated, clean,and comfortable. Breakfast was very good and fresh fruit is available on each floor. Good value. Helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leung B
Reviews.Content: The staff are very friendly, helpful and warm. The breakfast are very good. The room are not big but have everything we need.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room, nice people, good location, hidden costs”
Reviews.Author: Maryam M
Reviews.Content: The staff were very friendly, and the breakfast was good. The location was also quite central. Our room was quiet but had no view and was tiny. We had to put our suitcases under the sink the bathroom because in the bedroom, there was no room for them. The thing about queen beds in Italy is that they are usually two small beds pushed together. Our beds and pillows were not comfortable, unfortunately. The room was clean, however. And Internet was I think one euro (or included in the room), which is good. We asked the front desk if they could make printouts for us, and they said yes, but they did not mention that we would have to pay for each page, and when we checked out, we had to pay a 20-euro bill for the printouts. Not quite the service we were hoping for. Also it was super expensive for such a tiny room.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like Home...”
Reviews.Author: Frank C
Reviews.Content: After a 8 hour flight from Canada, Mario, the concierge, made us feel very welcome upon our arrival offering us coffee, juice etc. He was very helpful in providing us with a map of the area as wll as assisting us with local laundry services, restaurants and arranging for airport shuttle service to and from the airport. When we left for a week to another location, we made arrangements to return here and Mario again greeted us warmly. We stayed here for a week in September/2011 and look forward to conquering Rome! Thanks again Mario for all your help and we will see you soon again! Ciao from Frank and Tracy!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location! Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: Manny M
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 5 nights late August 2011. We arrived early so they expedited our room cleaning and got it ready way before they needed to. Because of the tripadvisor reviews I requested the largest room on the top floor....which I highly recommend! It was on the top floor, with a large bedroom, whirlpool tub and a great wrap-around terrace (with small outdoor eating area)...exquisite. My wife brought candles and lit up the outdoor area where hung out and looked down on the quiet street below. The breakfast was fabulous! Hot scrambled eggs, ham, fresh deli meats, baguettes, sausage, juices, breads, cereals, muffins. We would graze for about an hour and not be hungry till late afternoon. Saved us some cash and kept us satisfied for sure. Everyone was helpful, especially concierge. She gave us suggestions of sites to see, and was quite personable (The Italian way!)....Within five minutes of arriving she was showing us pictures of her kids! The whirlpool was great, worked well, a bit loud, but perfect. All the sites were within walking distance. It was hot when we went so we avoided the midday stroll, but were able to see Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain and others within a 15 minute walk in different directions. We also took a day trip up to Florence from Station Termini, which was only about a 5 min walk away from us.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay”
Reviews.Author: xvi0letx
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in August, 2011 for three nights. We are a couple in our early 30s from North America. Overall, the room was tiny but the stay was comfortable. I think there are a range of room sizes in the hotel and so I am sure experiences will vary. Location: Was very close to Termini station and to the metro, however if you are looking for a hotel "in the heart of rome" this would not be your choice. You had to take transit/have a long walk if you wanted to get to any of the major sites. It was not romantic, quaint or charming, It was just a comfortable place to sleep and eat breakfast. Food: Breakfast was comprehensive and good. Hot and cold choices. WiFi: The hotel has free wifi available, however neither my husband and I were able to access the networks on our smart phones. Service: We don't have any comments about the service, it was adequate. Nothing remarkable. Simply based on the location, I don't think I would stay here again if I return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel, no buts!”
Reviews.Author: Moy62
Reviews.Content: Good location, lovely room, very helpful staff, especially Maddelena on the reception, refreshments on arrival, even though we were very early we were able to check in and use our room, comfortable bed, everything clean, no noise,complimentary half bottle of wine, facilities to make your own hot drinks in the room, no fee for parking our car, what more can I say! Perfect! (Loved the fish tank and the rubber duck!)

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LOveditaly9090
Reviews.Content: We had a great time. The staff was very nice the room was clean and we liked the breakfast. And great Air conditioning. We stayed in room 404 for two nights.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: grasue
Reviews.Content: This lovely little gem that is in the heart of Rome. Close to most of the attractions some about a 10 to 15 min walk. The staff are friendly and ever so helpful, good advice on where to go and where to eat. Our room had just been renovated and was beautifuly decorated and clean. The room had kettle for tea and coffee which is unusual in European hotels. Breakfast had lots of choice from fruits and yogurts, cold meats,cheese to cooked breakfast good coffee. The whole hotel decor throughout was rich and lavish for such a small hotel. This ideal for a trip to Rome would stay again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable and Firendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelalot2000
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Hotel Britannia as the last stop on a two month trip to Europe. It was a very pleasant way to end the trip. We booked it sometime before our visit and we wondered if it would live up to the reviews. It did. It is a really pleasant hotel and reasonably priced (for Rome). The hotel is located just off the Via Nazionale and is a relatively easy walk to the main tourist attractions: The Forum and the Colosseum, the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain and the Piazza Navona. The main station is close by. The rooms are relatively small but well designed and the bathroom was good. The beds are very comfortable and we were lucky enough to get a balcony with a table and chairs – perfect on a warm summer night. The hotel serves a very good breakfast with some hot dishes as well as the traditional continental breakfast. The staff were helpful. There is limited parking but it is free if you book this ahead. There are some good restaurants nearby but if you like people watching settle in to one of the restaurants in Piazza Navona, have a nice meal and bottle of wine and enjoy the scene. Can recommend the hotel and we will use it again next time in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice small hotel with good staff (most of them) !”
Reviews.Author: Lolofans
Reviews.Content: Britannia is a nice small hotel and offers relatively good value for money (given that all hotels in Rome are expensive anyway). The hotel is located in a quiet street and the main street (Nationale) is just round the corner. It is in the middle of everything - but also mean it is close to nothing - all tour sites are at least 15 mins away on foot. One bad thing - restaurants recommended by one of the front desk staff are real bad !! Share your review:

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic in every respect.”
Reviews.Author: Paulettte
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in this excellent hotel - lovely room, great breakfasts, super location - short walk from teh train station, close to all the sites. Best of all was ur concierge, Mario. He arranged everything to perfection, including placing a phone call for me and translating my conversation to my Italian relatives - top notch service makes all the difference!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Cute and Quaint Hotel”
Reviews.Author: torontoguy2222
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for 3 nights before a Med. cruise. At the end of our cruise we also stayed 1 night at a different hotel, so this review is based on a comparison between both. Without a doubt Britannia was the better of the two. Both were supposedly 4* hotels, but Britannia felt more like a 3.5* one rather than a 2* one (like the other hotel did). The room we had was small, but the bed was big, there was closet space to hang your shirts/jackets, and washroom was decently sized with more counter space than we expected. The staff were always friendly and efficient, and those at the front desk were able to speak English very well. The hotel is centrally located about a 10m walk west of Termini station, which makes it closer to the main tourist sites to the west of the downtown. One of the highlights of this hotel was its breakfast: It put any breakfast I've had in a North American hotel to shame. The breakfast was more of a brunch than anything. You had the usual toast, coffee/espresso, eggs, bacon, but you also had some amazing fresh fruit, tonnes of pastries, cookies and cakes, prosciutto, cheeses, etc., even some sort of rice and mushroom dish which I didn't try. The dining room looked rather fancy and neat as well for such a small hotel. The waiters were always quick too. Overall, this hotel was excellent. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. If you're looking for a solid 3* hotel for a reasonable price in central Rome, this is the perfect place. Grazie tante!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we will be back”
Reviews.Author: ccbinfla
Reviews.Content: Not only was the hotel absolutely lovely, but the staff, (namely Mario and Jean Franco). They took such good care of us, from helping us with luggage, dinner plans, sites to see. Everything we needed they were right there with a smile. They really made our trip special and we have the best memories because of them.....The breakfast was included and it was wonderful. It always had fresh fruit and a wide selection of choices of food.

Reviews.Title: “Unique hotel with many peculiarities in room”
Reviews.Author: squizz20
Reviews.Content: I appreciated this hotel not just for its central location, but I remember it after many other hotels because of its specially decorated rooms. Apart from an old fashioned basis, there were many peculiarities in the room. There was a very simple fish tank with little fish in it. There was a "bath duck", although there was only a shower. There was a seventies style infrared lamp in the bathroom to "get a tan". There was fruit in the hall, which was great. There were many many (fake plants) around the hotel. All in all there were many things to discover, the owner seems to have an eye for detail (not necessarily for style, but that was fine with me). Very friendly staff willing to explain more about the hotel. I really enjoyed my stay here and will not forget it.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant staff and hotel does the job”
Reviews.Author: mt69
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant staff went out of their way to be helpful and for the money you probably can't expect much more in Rome, particularly in such a convenient area. The decor looks somewhat dated and the room seemed a tad dingy - if enlivened by the presence of a tank full of small fish. The big bed was comfortable and we got a good night's sleep. Breakfast was included and acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Small room but very nice.”
Reviews.Author: 1Rubicon1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel for 2 nights prior to Med. Cruise. The hotel was very nice. Staff friendly and helpful. The room was a little small, but I believe most in Rome are small. The breakfast was very good. Close to everything. All in all, I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “4 star”
Reviews.Author: hgaur
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located, close to Termini, the Metro and the bus lines. We were offered great advice on where to eat and what places to visit during our short stay in Rome.The premises are well taken care of and carefully planned. The breakfast in the morning was also nice. I will surely recommend this hotel to anyone who wishes to visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Realistic expectations make for a great travel experience."”
Reviews.Author: Legnan0
Reviews.Content: We chose the Britannia because of its proximity to the Opera House. It quickly proved itself agreeable on many other counts: a friendly, helpful staff, firm mattress, quiet side-street location, generous breakfast choices, large bathroom. The room, as advertised, was comfortable if a bit small; but we weren't in Rome to hang out in the room. We stayed six nights and enjoyed every one of them.

Reviews.Title: “A Small, Delightful Intimate Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Willowoodltd
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from staying in this delightful hotel. The staff were very friendly especially Mario on reception. Our room was very nice, it was clean & well presented. The Breakfast was wonderful, something for everyone. The location was not far from the main station but not too close. The hotel is tucked down a nice road off a very busy main road with lots of shops, easy for getting buses over to the Vatican. We were able to walk from the hotel to a lot of the main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Sabbycat12
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel four 5 nights on our recent trip to Rome. We chose it because of the great location, the fact it was rated four stars, and it was not too crazy expensive. (Approx. 200 euro a night). We arrived from a cruise ship, so we were there at 11am. To our astonishment, we were given a room right away. (We figured we would have to just leave our bags and come back later.) The front desk staff was efficient and polite. They have a good command of the English language. The room was quite large for Rome. The bathroom had a bathtub! The tub was quite narrow, but I am a small person, 5 foot 2 inches and only 120 lbs, so I fit fine. One tip for a shower here is to leave the curtain half way open otherwise it will keep flying back on you! Hot water was NEVER an issue here. (We have had issues in the past while in Italy, so this was good). The room only has approx. 7 hangers, not much for two people. You may be able to get more, but I never asked. The fish tank in the bedroom is a great feature! My biggest problem with this hotel, and the only reason I did not give it a higher overall rating was the bed and pillows; mainly the pillows really. The bed was hard, and if your partner moves, you will feel it. The pillows are WORTHLESS. I ended up with a stiff neck on the third night that never went away until I got home and to my own pillow and heating pad. (And by stiff, I mean stiff.) It is important to know that this hotel is across the street from an Irish pub. The pub while a good place to eat and drink, especially at lunch when their prices are competitive, gets VERY noisy some nights. We had to close our window several nights. With that said, the hotel windows are very good at keeping out the sound. The breakfast is okay. The eggs were runny, and the breakfast sausage is a wiener! The bacon is good, but salty. The mushrooms and rice at breakfast is weird, but quite tasty!!! The croissants were yummy. The fresh fruit is very good. I loved the coffee, it was very strong. They serve it with warm milk! Overall, I would recommend this hotel, but I would give the warning about the pillow - the biggest issue.

Reviews.Title: “Delivered as promised”
Reviews.Author: SEAPOINTER
Reviews.Content: As Roman hotels go, this one provides a bit more than most in its price category. Service is friendly, rooms are adequate by US standards but large by those in Rome. Typical room gives you a queen bed, chair, desk, closet with shelves, and good sized bathroom. Free wireless internet service is available. Breakfast is excellent with usual pastries, juices, bread and fruit but also hot selections (scrambled eggs, bacon and hot cereal). Tip: ask your waiter for cappuccino instead of the standard coffee.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: JUDIShrivenham
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a five night break at the Britannia hotel Rome. Without any hesitation we would recommend this hotel. We had booked using the internet, but prior to making a reservation we asked pertient questions which were answered via email promptly. The hotel arranged a transfer from the airport which was friendly and efficient. On arrival , we were welcomed by Mario one of the receptionists. We were given liquid refreshments and biscuits whilst our luggage was delivered to our rooms. The rooms are adequate but have to admit the bathroom was small. The whole room is cleverly lined with mirrors ( these are scarey first thing in the morning, and we are on a diet now!! The hotel only offers Band B but the breakfasts are excellent, suiting all nationalities and plenty of it. It ranges from cold meats and cheeses, fresh fruit salad to hot choices. The location is brilliant -once we had our bearings we could walk to most of the popular attractions. However we did use the hop on hop off bus and the metro. There are local eating places very close and a supermarket 50 yds away. Mario is a mine of information and speaks perfect English.He could answer all of our questions and requests and will also arrange tours for you. WE were fortunate to enjoy to enjoy clear blue skies and sunshine for our visit. Three top tips; Rome is no place for your Jimmy Choos!!!! Most of the roads are cobbled and very uneven, so pack comfortable shoes. If you have time take the local transport to the Tivoli Gardens. We escaped the heat of the city and travelled approx an hour and a half into the countryside and up into the mountains. It was breathtaking,with endless waterfalls and fountains, as well as the views back towards Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A small great hotel in the perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Fillone
Reviews.Content: Hotel Britannia is a very small hotel located in the heart of Rome: the Colosseum, Piazza Venezia, the Fora and many other attractions are close by, 10 minutes on feet. The Rooms are medium sized, but very well adorned: big bathroom (tv in it) and safe are in the rooms. The staff were extremely kind to us. Interesting, they have a small parking lot that you can have for 10 euros a day (about 14 dollars, really good!). Overall, we had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Charming , cosy, conveniant location on a quiet road, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: dudders86
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend for a 4 night trip to Rome. We booked a double superior room and requested a balcony and jacuzzi room. Our room was cosy, not massively spacious, but very happy with it. The balcony was actually a patio area with two chairs and a table. When we arrived we were greeted with a welcome coffee/iced tea. The staff are friendly and attentive. The breakfast was fulfilling offering almost everything - eggs, bacon, cereals, fruit salads, toast, tomatoes, coissants. The location is walking distance from the colloseium (about 15 min walk) and the Spanish Steps. Because this is a converted old mansion, it's not a hustling hotel, so the bar is very quiet (it could do with a bit of back ground music). but we got everything we wanted out of the hotel. The hotel was extremely clean. Everytime we left the hotel (and left our key with the receptionist) our rooms would be tidied and the bed made up, whatever time of day. That was a great extra touch. The bed we had was actually two singles pushed together to make 1 double, but that was the only down side. Our room also had a cute little fish in a fish bowl! I'd definitely recommend this hotel. The hotel has lots of character and has a very cosy feel about it.

Reviews.Title: “Choose this hotel if you value quality of service over the quality of their rooms”
Reviews.Author: Ike_fedas
Reviews.Content: This is a strange hotel. It is a four star hotel with very good service, friendly staff, an excellent breakfast e.g. Fresh fruit. The rooms are minute, we asked for their biggest room (3 persons) and it really felt crowded. The bathroom is so small that when you sit on tge toilet you have your right leg under the washbasin (apologies for the detail but it gives you a good reference of how small it is). The rooms also need refurbushing, e.g. A very old carpet. The rooms do look like in an old London hotel. By the way we had A fishbowl in our room (nice) but also ants (not so nice). overall it seems that the hotel is trying hard but spending its budget where it doesn't count e.g. They have two cleaning lady rounds, one to open your bed. For us the price ranged from EUR 170 to EUR 200 depending on the day. From my point of view, clearly too expensive for the quality. The prroof we moved to Hotel Canada at EUR 140 (3 stars) but so much better.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: GeoffandPamOldBar
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel twice: at the start of our visit to Italy and again before we flew home. It was great on both occasions. Walking distance from termini and a comfortable walk from many sights and attractions. Rooms smallish (naturally) but comfortable and clean. The front desk was always very helpful and the breakfasts were superb. Even an internet cafe across the street. Could not have asked for a better place to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rpribeiro
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel. Comfortable, clean and cosy rooms Excelent service. Very nice staff

Reviews.Title: “DEFINITELY NOT 4-STAR!!”
Reviews.Author: ssmosley
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on their photos and Tripadvisor reviews. But arriving there from Paris, we were surprised to find a totally different Hotel Britannia than illustrated or advertised! This is a very old and rather dingy hotel with the tiniest rooms I've ever seen (our triple-bed room measures merely 15x15feet or roughly 5.5x5.5 meters); the bathroom was not more than 6x6 feet and its door frame was rotting; the paint on the heater was peeling off and rusted; the elevator measured about 3x4 feet and was so small that the three of us could barely fit in it. The furnishings in the room were very dated (old) and looked more like the furnishing from a very low-class hotel; the carpeting was worn out and faded. We were told we had free Satellite TV in the room, but our TV (a very old thing the size of a 12x12 inch computer monitor) did not have more than a French news channel, a commercials-laden RTL station in German (luckily I understand German but was sick of watching commercials and infomercials all day long). I asked for help and the staff member who came to our room couldn't find anything more than a BBC station, the rest was PAY TV. etc... The staff was at all times very polite and helpful. From the Breakfast servers (good breakfast buffet) to front desk and the porters, everyone was very nice and pleasant. The only exception was the day of departure. Upon arrival, we were asked if we'd pay with credit card or with cash in exchange for a 10% discount, and we said we'd probably pay cash, the receptionist told us it really didn't matter that much to nail it down. On the day of departure, we did not have enough cash and I offered to pay a part in cash and the balance with a credit card. The receptionist, Cesare, refused and was quite upset and kept repeating that we had promised to pay in cash! He made no effort to conceal his disdain and anger over that issue. Britannia is situated in a good area with easy access to Termini train station and many of the attractions, but I would not give this hotel any more than a 2-star rating, particularly after finding other 4-star hotels nearby, such as the IQ hotel, Stendhal Hotel etc that were truly 4-star hotels at a lower nightly rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and within walking distance to all attractions.”
Reviews.Author: rebecca11767
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Britannia between15th and 17th November, travelling with my mum, sister and 18 month old son. After a short walk from the Termini, we arrived at the hotel early were grateful they checked us in as soon as possible. The hotel is clean and had a traditional Italian feel to it, the staff were friendly and helpful. It is set back on a side street so you dont hear the noise of the traffic. We stayed in a triple room 102 and my son had a cot. The room wasnt large, but completely adequate for our short break. The decor was very traditional, beds comfortable. Bathroom lovely, even had a tv and a fish bowl. Breakfast was very nice, great continential varitey to choose from and service was excellent. The hotel was in close walking distance to all the attraction it took about 15 mins to walk to the trevi fountain, but its a pleasant walk with lots to see on the way. The colloseum is spectacular and again about 15 mins walk. We took a bus to the Vactican as it is a bit further out of the town, there are buses everywhere so you dont have too wait long. The hotel was very pleasant and I would definately recommend staying there and would return. There are so many amazing sights to see in Rome, a stunning historic city I would recommend visiting.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in a fantastic city”
Reviews.Author: jpost99
Reviews.Content: We spent four days in this high quality hotel and enjoyed every minute. The rooms are clean, well appointed, and cozy. The breakfast is outstanding in the beatuful room off the lobby. The location is excellent with a short walk to the train station, restaurants, and shops of all kinds. Mario is the man behind the desk that knows what you need before you ask. His personality and knowledge of the city set the pace for the staff. He knows all the best places to eat and shop. The Hotel Britannia is an excellent choice. John & Pat Post Atlanta, Ga

Reviews.Title: “A very good and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: BishopLatimer
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights on the basis of recommendations of others on Trip Advisor. The hotel is in a side street just of Via Nacionale. It is quiet (for Rome) with just a background hum of traffic noise. The two rooms we had were clean (about 14 feet by 10 feet) with cotton bed sheets and reasonable built in storage for bags and clothes. The bathrooms had a biggish bath with shower and were clean and reasonably large. Breakfast is very generous and the staff are very helpful. There is a small lounge. I would stay here again. It is convenient for the Forum, for Trevi, and for Via Veneto. A longish walk to Navona, and quite a hike to St Peters and Trastevere. But the buses to these places are cheap and easy to use and run from just along from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again - Rome Must Have Something Better To Offer”
Reviews.Author: JJnzNz
Reviews.Content: Similar experience to Rup22000 dated 29th June 2010 The good first our concerige was fantastic organised parking & our bags to our room in the rain. Location was assessable to tour buses, shopping & restraunts. We did get another 10% discount if we payed cash & we had already recieved an online early booking discount. Parking on site good but only space for half dozen cars. However; $520.00EUR (2nights) - 1 x Classic double room, 1xSun lamp in the room (dusty shade in the corner), 1xFruit basket (not in the room outside the lift for everyone), 1x up grade (From what?), 2xWireless connection free, 2xwelcome drink (If you ask for it), 2xAmerican Buffet Breakfast (Average quality), 1xParking. Far too expence for the experience we recieved. The Room let itself down the safe malfunctioned & was open when we got back from the day, there was a white powder all over the floor because it caked my socks, the walls were paper thin I could hear everything including the kids next door playing & yelling for 2 days including the door bell & the light shone through the vent all night. Bathroom was average but clean but the shower a nightmare to use & maintain temp. It must of backed onto the bathroom of the room next door because you could hear everything going on next door. Breakfast atmosphere non existent it had half a spread but the quality was poor. I had a yoghurt & just about lost it because it was off I tried complaining but english was not there strengths. The bacon I think micowaved it tasted looked plastic & the mushrooms were just slimy & tasted like the day before. I noticed no one had touched it. No music in the dinning room I might as well been eating in my basement. The waiter looked really aggitated every time I got up to get something or used another utensil or plate. He just wasnt friendly. Probably the sadest breakfast experience we had. Getting to the hotel do not do in a car. To get there you have to drive up a one way street with traffic going in the opposite direction. You have to drive in the taxi/bus only lane. Miss the turn off & you lose another 20mins. The hotel is located down a lonely dark alleyway you would never guess. Overall not a experience of a lifetime. I would like to say the review that Rup22000 dated 29th June 2010 did had alot of substance & a shame we read it after we got back from our trip

Reviews.Title: “Molto bene”
Reviews.Author: cm9720
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Britannia for four nights. The reception staff are friendly and very welcoming. The location of the hotel is ideal for all the main attractions of Rome and is only a 10 minute walk from the Train Station. By the end of our stay we had also worked out the Trevi fountain was only a 15 minute walk. The breakfast is a buffet - a selection of cereals and pastries as well as scambled eggs, sausages and bacon. The bacon was nothing special but the coffee is fantastic! Rooms were very clean and a decent size - we were slightly amused to find a small goldfish in the bathroom. The bath is quite small but I actually found it was just the write size for me and I enjoyed a good soak after a day spent walking around Rome. A little expensive maybe but is anywhere in Rome cheap?

Reviews.Title: “Elegance with friendly service”
Reviews.Author: denverretiree
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a first rate location near some very good restaurants. Breakfast was lavish and service was outstanding. Worth the price. The hotel gives a 10% discount if you pay in cash or euros.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, unpretentious and accommodating”
Reviews.Author: Clo_MT
Reviews.Content: Located in a good shopping area within a reasonable walking distance to the Piazza della Repubblica and the colosseum about equal distance further. This is an old mansion converted into a hotel and has the charm that goes with such a history. We found our room and bathroom clean and a nice size by European standards. Free internet. Adequate continental breakfast, good coffee. A very accommodating and helpful staff. Mario made an excellent suggestion for us for a dinner restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: EndlessSummer29
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently returned from a fabulous stay in Italy, and the Hotel Britannia was the perfect choice for our time in Rome. Believe the reviews! The location is a hop, skip and a jump from the main train station (Stazione Termini), and gives easy access to all major points of interest in the city. We didn't spend a dime on taxis, and walked, walked, walked everywhere. The Forum, Colesseum, Spanish Steps, and Pantheon were all a short trek away. For the less fit seeking more remote attractions, there was a Metro station a couple of blocks away. Internet access is provided free of charge, and there is a small room, complete with computer, just off the lounge, near the reception area. The Hotel has a couple of neat, little amenities, including a pair of live goldfish in each bathroom (we named ours Fred & Wilma in honour of the Flintstones' 50th anniversary) and rubber duckies in the bath. We celebrated a wedding anniversary during our stay, and the management sent up complimentary champagne, which was a very nice touch. The Britannia is a boutique style hotel tucked away just off the Via Nazionale. The rooms are bright and clean, with high ceilings and comfortable beds but, as with any older hotel, the bathrooms could use a little updating. The rooms are small by North American standards but, hey, it's just a place to sleep. We weren't expecting to be able to play tennis in there! My wife and I stayed in room 203 during our first week in Rome, and then again in room 102 on our final night before flying home, after spending a week in Positano. Room 102 was the better of the two, but the bathroom was not a nice. A full breakfast each morning is included. As mentioned by another review, the Britannia provided a relatively quiet stay in noisy Roma, although nothing could mask the sirens from those Italian ambulances, which seem to rule the streets in Rome. Our new best friend, Mario, who worked the early evenings at the desk, was terrific when it came to steering us in the right direction. We were looking for a quick dinner one evening, and he directed us to a little hole in the wall at the end of Via Napoli, minutes from the hotel. It didn't look like much at first, but it was great!! Mario always had a smile, and a funny story, whenever we stopped to chat. Both he, Maddelena the day receptionist, and Emilio and Lee John in the breakfast room, made our stay warm and enjoyable. Don't hesitate to make the Britannia your choice for a memorable stay in beautiful Rome!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: meexxx
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay very much. The staff were friendly and very helpful. The location is excellent - in walking distance (20 minutes) to the Forum and Colosseum, 10 minutes to the train station. 5 minutes to the bus and metro stops. Nice breakfast. he welcome drink. The actual room was lovely with nice touches such as the fish bowl and plastic toy in the bathroom. The bathroom was spotless and I appreciated the private balcony The person who took me through the room was excellent. He showed me all the facilities, how everything worked etc.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: rsowah
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel last minute while in London and we were extremely happy with our selection. The reviews from tripadvisor helped greatly. The hotel was wonderfully presented, clean and most importantly, in a city as busy as Rome, very quiet. I would recommend this hotel to anyone going to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location .. and value and a great breakfast and...”
Reviews.Author: Malone2
Reviews.Content: From Hotel Britannia, take a walk and in ten or twenty minutes you can be at the Coliseum or at Spanish Steps in the opposite direction. And between the two are countless churches and sites that date up to 2000 years old. The hotel desk staff were always helpful. Superb Italian Pizza (wood oven baked) right on Via Nationale only a couple blocks towards the train station. Great shopping in the area (not Louis V or Gucci . Armani and that crowd - and not junk from asia). Hotel rooms were very comfortable - obviously very old but simple and clean. The breakfast was the best I had in three weeks in Italy for variety and fresh food. This hotel is not the Ritz Carlton but it is great value. Be sure to check out Basilica di Santa Maria Maggiore right around the corner. As well as the church at the end of Via Nationale - very interesting artwork. Also within a very interesting and short walk is the Santa Maria della Concezione dei Cappuccini - truly one of Romes most unique , macabre and interesting sites. Internet across the street was very well priced. Groceria within a block.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing weekend”
Reviews.Author: Chuk_I_Gek
Reviews.Content: It was sudden decision to go to Rome.. We choose Britannia relying recommendations on this site and have to say - its pretty much what is written here. Hotel is situated relatively far from the main tourist roads so we walked back twice, and afterwards took taxi every time we wanted to go to the hotel. Room was really small. Probably the smallest room we ever been to. However very clean and comfortable.. Breakfast was good and stuff friendly and not annoying. And indeed there were mosquitoes... We liked this hotel a lot, however will try to find something closer to the centre if not too over expensive next time in Rome

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, quiet, convenient”
Reviews.Author: athain
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay. Tasty breakfast buffet. Front Desk very helpful. Junior Suite we stayed in was roomy, had decent King bed. Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...Awesome Location”
Reviews.Author: StuMacAndrews
Reviews.Content: When planning for our trip to Rome, my wife and I really struggled to choose a hotel. We finally chose the Hotel Britannia, based mainly on online reviews, and we were very happy with our selection. Everything about the hotel was very good, but the two best things were the hotel staff and the location. As you can see on the map, the hotel is located on Napoli just off National. National is a major and very busy (read noisy) street but Napoli is narrow and very quite. From the hotel we were easily able to walk to most of the major sites with the exception of the Vatican and the Pantheon was a bit far (but we did walk). It is also only a couple blocks from the main train/subway station so it is possible to walk to or a cheap cab ride when checking in/out. The other thing we were happiest with was the entire hotel staff. They were extremely helpful in recommending restaurants (even making reservations for us, Thanks Mario!), times and sites to visit, and answering/addressing every additional question. The all speak English, but we found them and other locals in general, to be much more responsive when we at least tried to speak Italian. On the only slightly down side, we were were a little surprised at the size of the actual room. The king size bed took up nearly all the room and the closet was a little small, but the bathroom was surprisingly large and extremely nice. The room really wasn't a huge issue, because we spent most of the time site-seeing and exploring all that Rome has to offer. Additionally, there was only one English speaking TV channel. A few more would have been nice at the end of the day. The Internet access was also included and was nice to have, but by no means was it super fast. The breakfast was also included and very nice, plus it was available until 10 a.m. which was nice on the mornings after the late nights when we had too much vino. Overall, we were very happy with our hotel choice and would stay there again without a second thought.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Hotel Stay -Recommend!”
Reviews.Author: P_G_Welsh
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Britannia after reading some other solid reviews from tripadvisor. It's location is great. It is in the hub of everything and we managed to walk everywhere from the hotel. It is also close to the Central train station..... but not too close. Rome is a city that has to be walked because around every corner is a new surprise. By North American standards the rooms are small but by European standards the room size is ample (I've stayed in smaller hotels elsewhere). Other reviewers mentioned that the TV is old and small.... but you're in Rome!!!! what are you doing watching television!? Rome is such a vibrant, buzzing city with so much happening all day and through the night. The hotel offers a good buffet breakfast. A good assortment of cold and hot options and a server to bring a fresh pot of coffee. I would highly recommend including the breakfast with your stay. You can leave the hotel with a full belly and plenty of energy to see you through to supper. The front desk is very friendly and helpful with any advice or guidance you may need. The hotel is in a charming older building. It is a 4 storey structure with a small elevator and a narrow winding staircase. The age and character of the building made the stay more interesting. The hot water was very hot, the water pressure was good and the rooms were spotless. WIFI is also available through the hotel (you need to ask front desk for username and password) Another nice touch is the fruit bowls to be found on every floor; filled with pears, apples peaches & plums. There MAY be more affordable hotels in the area (there also may not be). The Britannia is not the Hilton but it's a uniquely Roman hotel with a solid reputation. Thank you Mario for a great stay. If we return to Rome we will see you again.

Reviews.Title: “4 stars...really?”
Reviews.Author: scintillater
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a pretty decent location, and I suppose for the price it isn't bad. But I'd rate it a 3 star hotel, not a 4 star. When we first got in, the sink was leaking profusely all over the bathroom floor. Second, the toilet is terrible. We had to use a 'special technique' just to get it to flush down two squares of toilet paper. By the way, they have those individually dispensed toilet paper squares rather than a roll. The beds are quite small as is the room, and rather hard and you only get a small flat pillow. We had a triple room so I know the selection is rather limited. Service was pretty friendly, though we did ask for ice a couple times and it never came. The best part of this hotel is the breakfast: it's a surprisingly good buffet with good selection, coffee, juices, etc. MUCH better than a continental breakfast you'd get in North America. We stayed here for our first half of our Italy trip, and we also stayed at Hotel IQ. They cost the same pretty much, and Hotel IQ is MUCH better. I'd stay there instead if you can get the rate.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: bearwald
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 nights in April. We called direct to the hotel and they were able to slide a 4th bed into one of the large front rooms. This makes it a very crowded room, but we travel very light and don't need a lot of floor space. The bathroom had a pair of goldfish and plenty of room. They sent a car to the airport to pick us up (70Euro) and when we got in around 10AM they stored our luggage, gave us a some orange juice and a map and off we went with the promise that our room would be ready in an hour. Sure enough, when we came back around noon, the room was ready. The hotel is comfortable, the breakfasts are wonderful and everything we needed was in walking distance. Termini is just a few short blocks away, as is a metro entrance.

Reviews.Title: “Solid choice in Rome”
Reviews.Author: santos71
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a block off Via Nazionalle and gets no traffic noise from the street in the morning or during the day. THere is no bar or restaurant to disturb you at night. We had stayed three nights on arrival to Italy and two nights before the departure and had superior rooms on the third floor. Rooms ar on smaller size but that is what was expected. Bathrooms are marble, clean and really spacious . One room had a window in the bathroom which was very nice. Airconditioning could be regulated in the room and worked well. Staff was helpful and non intrusive. You can only hear your next door neighboors a little, otherwise no noise from upstairs or any other rooms. Breakfast can not be described in no other way than fantastic. Three eggs choices, good quality proscuito, nice cheese, sauteed forest mushrooms!, strawberies, variety of bread.... . Espresso great too. Really close to subway - two blocks, 3 min to take you to see Forum and museum or elsewhere. Far enough from the crowds of the Main Railroad Station. Do not get a rental car there, quite a hassle to drive around Rome - you are not even supposed to pick your luggage from the hotel as you do not have permit to drive around. take a train and get it wherever you go. If yo do not order GPS in advance they do not have any. Buses run on Via Nazionalle to get you closer to downtown if you do not feel like walking. It is 10 min walk to the big fountain and 15 to Pantheon. Many restaurants on the way or further north if you walk that direction. Taxi takes you back for less than 10 euros. A grocery store and a liquer store 100 yards down. Overall a good solid choice if you do not look for romantic neighborhood but convenience/.

Reviews.Title: “Just returned from a 4 night stay at this...”
Reviews.Author: SteveS1971
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay at this hotel. The location is easy to plan days out from and a not far from Termini station. The front reception stairs look impressive upon arrival and the reception staff were always helpful (Mario in particular always went out of his way to help). We upgraded from the standard room and had an impressive and relaxing balcony right at the front of the hotel, the room was clean, well appointed and presented. The only let down on the room was the bathroom and the minibar. The brass plates around the light switches in the bathroom were damaged and kept falling off, the plug was too big for the plug hole in the bath (had to hold in place until the water pressure held it there) and the sun lamp as advertised on their website was missing the bulb so could not be used despite the instructions still being in the bathroom. The minibar had seen better days, did not chill the drinks and was extremely rusty on the bottom. As other reviewers have stated the breakfast was outstanding, great food and very efficient service. Overall a great hotel let down by a couple of little niggles.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel to explore Rome”
Reviews.Author: tfbooij
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel and professional and friendly staff. Centrally located to shops and the Roma MetreBus that will take you conveniently to all the major sites. Close to the main Roma trainstation.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was beautiful and was close to main attractions, very gracious.”
Reviews.Author: reeves65
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Britannia, July 2010 and was very impressed with the service and the breakfast. We arrived at night (9:30 pm) and there are stairs to go down in the hotel and we had to carry heavy lugggage down stairs, guess valet was gone for the day; that night the night clerk was not friendly and we thought ...hope everyone else is not this way and to our pleasure they were not; the rest of the staff was cordial, helpful and professional. Our room was fairly small and so was the bathroom, it was very nice, clean and beautiful. We obtained this reservation through Hotels.com which I like to do business with; however, our room was not like in the pictures, so when you make reservations you might ask what size room you are getting. We also traveled with another couple, their room was also small but a great bathroom with fish tank and extra dressing area...just be sure and ask. The breakfast is $12 Euros each. I would recvommend staying here and I would stary there again if we ever get to go back. Ask for Mario he is the greatest; works at the receptionist desk but help us with tours and a great place to eat just down the street. The hotel is accessible to places to eat. We actually walked from the Coliseum back to the hotel...just get their map and go.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel for a short break in Rome”
Reviews.Author: tydur
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a quiet street some 600 metres from the railway station with good access to the two underground lines as well as a number of bus routes for the city centre. Whilst the bedrooms are a little on the small side, doubtless this is a common feature of hotels in the centre of Rome rather dictated by the restrictions imposed by the original design of the buildings for other purposes. We were comfortable enough and went to Rome to see the city, not to spend much time in the bedroom. The hotel is also located in an area where there are restaurants a plenty so you are spoilt for choice as to where to eat. The hotel staff were always first class in their responses to our various requests and provided clear directions as to which buses to take to go to the various attractions. If we were to visit Rome again for a couple of nights, I wouldn`t bother looking for anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location with a Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: our-time-around
Reviews.Content: The Britannia is within walking to distance to most major sites in Rome. Staff was friendly and helpful with information. The hotel breakfast was excellent! Although the rooms were a bit small, (who needs a big room when you are touring?) the amenities included a safe, hair dryer and refrigerator. Little touches like an aquarium and a rubber duck were fun! A very clean hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here When In Rome !!!!”
Reviews.Author: maxemoto
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough about how much we enjoyed our stay at Hotel Britannia. The room we stayed was a little smaller than we would have liked and we didn't have much of a view,but it's location more than made up for that.We we're only a few steps from the Metro and Termini Station.The hotel was really in walking distance to many landmarks ( maps can be deceiving ) yet was on a quiet side street only one block off a main avenue.The staff was more than helpful ! Everyone spoke excellent English and gave us directions,exchanged Dollars for Euros at the main desk and in general we're Pleasant,Friendly and Helpful. Oh they also has a nice breakfast laid out to start the day ( make sure you get it included when booking your room ) ! Definitely stay here !

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel within easy walking of main station”
Reviews.Author: MagellansTours
Reviews.Content: We had a pleasant welcome and were offered a drink upon arrival. We had booked a superior room which turned out to be at the top of the hotel (#42), included a small aquarium complete with two fish and a small very bright private terrace – good for pre-dinner prosecco! The room itself was comfortable and had tea and coffee making facilities which was great. The bathroom was small but adequate. It had a Jacuzzi bath that didn’t work, a good shower and a bidet which took up too much space. Linen/towels were fresh and the room was clean. Nice to have free WiFi in the bedroom. The buffet breakfast was probably one of the best that we have ever had in a small private hotel. There was a good choice of bread, cereals, fruit and cold meats. In addition, there was an excellent cooked breakfast on offer – no dry and rubbery scrambled eggs here!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and did I mention, excellent service!!!”
Reviews.Author: IdahoFamily_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our last night in Italy (whirlwind trip began in Rome, then Sorrento, then Florence and back to Rome to fly out next day). Mario Teti greeted us with a great smile and gave us fantastic service. I asked Mario about when we should arrive at the airport the next morning so we could plan when to catch the train and he asked me if €50 is a better deal than €56 (€14 per person) and which would I choose. Instead of hiking back to the train the next morning, he arranged a private minivan for my family that picked us up in the lobby (boy, do they know how to drive in Italy - what a great ride). We had a great stay and would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The location is very good, but...staff, service & room were not!”
Reviews.Author: Janice51
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel with a friend and two family members. I had done the booking after being referred by another hotel which was full. The location was very good as it was close to train station (Termini) and within walking distance of the hop on/hop off tour bus and a few other main attractions in the city. My first disappointment was with our room and the increased cost in comparison to my two family members' room...they were given an 'upgrade' and ours was a low grade for more money...40 Euros per night more for basically the same room. The TVs which were supposedly upgrades did not work properly, nor did the internet in our room. We did not get the 'turn down service' both nights (only one night) but the other room did! When we went to the bar in the hotel lobby at 10 min. to 11 pm. no one asked if we might like anything, and when I enquired after 11 pm. they told me it was closed! Three people were on staff at the front desk and no one asked if we might like anything from the bar when we arrived, nor 'just before it was supposedly closed'. When we inquired about our room, we were told it was 'the luck of the draw'...they were fully booked and if we were to move we might get a lower grade room for the same price my family were paying for their room....Just did not seem logical let alone fair. To top it off, on check out, we were told we had a laundry bill! We did not do any laundry as we were only in Rome for two days...they did credit this, but I think they thought we were mistaken!!! Breakfast was the only other good thing about the hotel. It was very ample and the breakfast staff were very cordial....Unfortunately I will not stay here again, nor would I recommend it to any one else to stay here, unless they were guaranteed a better class of room for less money!

Reviews.Title: “If this is a 4-star hotel, I'm really Elvis Presley”
Reviews.Author: Rup22000
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel Britannia for the last night of our honeymoon. I must say that I'm disappointed after my stay. When I researched hotels, I thought I was getting a deal for a 4-star hotel for under 200 Euro a night! I figured it must be that price because it was near Termini, which is not necessarily the prime area to stay in Rome. I also thought I was staying in a place that was going to be romantic, modern, and clean. I'm likely to offend the hotel owners/staff with my comments, but this is not a 4-star hotel. I've had better accommodations at 2-star hotels in the U.S. than this place. We stayed in room 402 (the room with the Rose painting and terrace on the hotel's website). On the website, the hotel and accommodations looked sheik, modern and romantic. Upon arrival, my wife and I saw that it was nothing like the pictures. Instead, it was going to be a no-frills place to just lay a head before shipping off to the airport. We in fact went out to dinner that night and drank an excessive amount to ensure that we would just pass out once we got back to the hotel. I would not stay here again because of the reasons listed below. Furthermore, if you are a U.S. resident and on a honeymoon, I would definitely not stay here because it is not romantic, it's in a lackluster area of Rome, and there are nicer places for the same price range or less in the same area. My reasons why this is not a 4-star hotel (which in my mind would be one star below at St. Regis): -The last time the hotel was renovated had to have been in the late 1980's or early 1990's; the website shows one awesome looking room with shelves above the bed. That room must be the best room in the place because the others don't look like that. The breakfast area has the same story. -No wash cloths in the bathroom -The room was infested with ants. The ants had free reign of the bathroom (toilet, sink, tub, door), the carpet and the bed. -The safe was from 1980 and was malfunctioning. -The car service arranged through the hotel was a run down Kia minivan. We could have caught a taxi to the airport for less than 50 Euro and at least rode in a run down Mercedes. Seems like a 4-star hotel would have better managed that aspect. -The breakfast spread is pretty basic with limited selection compared to other 4-star hotels where we stayed. -The wooden head board on the bed had what appeared to be termite damage (or some other type of wood eating organism). -The mattress was hard. Honestly, the other hotel we stayed in for the first part of our trip in Rome, Hotel Madrid, which is a 3-star hotel, had nicer accommodations. It was at least clean. If I had to rate this hotel, I'd say it would be a 3-star hotel on it's best day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great service & good central location”
Reviews.Author: HerculeP
Reviews.Content: From the moment that we arrived we knew that we had made the right choice. Although it was only 10am we were shown straight away to our room (which was smallish but perfectly acceptable), and which was spotlessly clean. The bed was very comfortable and although the room was at the 'front' of the hotel there was absolutely no noise. A wide range of complimentary fruit was available in the hall, and we were amazed to find tea/coffee making facility in the room (rare in an Italian hotel). The air condition worked perfectly but our only slight criticism was that the hot water could have been warmer. As other reports have stated, the breakfast was very good with a very wide choice (pastries and cakes were too sweet, but it is Italy afterall). Vast choice of local restaurants providing everything from fast food to very upmarket meals, and prices were quite reasonable. The location couldn't be better, where you can stroll to all the major attaractions within 15 minutes. In addition it's less than 5 minutes from the main railway station (we used the hotel's own transfer back to the airport which was excellent for a reasonable 50euros). There is a supermarket just 50m way and another 200m in the other direction. We booked via the hotel's own website, and if you pay by cash on check-out we were also offered a generous 10% discount. Overall excellent value in a good hotel which is in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Hotel”
Reviews.Author: smd22
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Britannia for three nights at the end of a cruise. This is the fourth time we have stayed at this hotel. It is a very comfortable small hotel. The rooms are small but adequate in size and quiet. The beds are comfortable and the staff is very helpful. The breakfasts are outstanding. The price is reasonable for Rome. It is located near Termini Station.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Great location”
Reviews.Author: zzzusa
Reviews.Content: The location was wonderful and the staff were very helpful. The room was not large but quite comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: mike_pope40
