Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for it's location, being within walking distance of the main station and still close to Rome's main tourist attractions. The rooms are average size for Roman hotels, clean and comfortable. Good breakfast, superb coffee. The only negative point is the fish bowl with a couple of forlorn guppies in in the rooms, described in the hotel brochure as tropical aquariums! The main advantage with this hotel is the Mario factor. Mario is the night manager and nothing is too much trouble for him. He's a mine of information, even knows train times by memory. We will certainly stay there again and hopefully the fish bowls will have gone.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant Roman holiday.”
Reviews.Author: Madmarz
Reviews.Content: Found wonderful reviews about the hotel and chose it based on them and the location, photos, rate and staff responses to my questions. Rooms were very clean and bed was comfortable. Breakfast was more than many larger hotels and always fresh, especially the fruit. Maddalena and Mario were very helpful to any questions/needs we had. They made arrangemets for pick-up and return to airport, which went very smoothly. Also had a small breakfast packed for our very early departure. They even allowed us free use of a computer so that we were able to check-in for our flight the day before.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant yet simple, this hotel is a comfortable refuge from the busy city.”
Reviews.Author: jmefishin
Reviews.Content: From the time we got there the hotel staff at the Britannia made us feel welcome. Small but elegant the Britannia is well located to the places you want to go. They serve a nice breakfast to start your day. I would recomend Britannia to my friends and family absolutely... Jon and Stephanie

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, Fantastic Service and good location”
Reviews.Author: mao70
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 days with my mother. The hotel entrance is a little tricky if you have problems going down stairs., but once inside the hotel there is an elevator that works well and fits 2 people and small laugage. Nevertheless, the location was good, just a few blocks from train station and half a block from bus stop, and close to shopping area and local restaurants and small cafes. The service was Fantastic. They were always helpful in giving you information (on places to go, eat and transportation) and in providing anything that we needed at any time of the day. When we arrived the room that we had reserved did not have the shower that we had asked for, so they switched us to a room that had a shower without any trouble at all. The room with the bathtub was bigger than the one with the shower. But the bathroom with the shower was bigger than the other, which was good as my mother has knee problems and that was more accessible. The rooms were very clean, very well kept. It was the nicest room we stayed in Italy in our whole trip. The decoration has features from England in the19th century. We realized that is just afew blocks from the Great Britain Embassy. THe only thing is that the temperature of the rooms is standard for all the building (you ca not change it), we found it a little hot some days (since it was November they had the heater on and they do not turn the air conditioner on during that time) so we openned the windows a few minutes and it was comfortable afterwards. We stayed in a higher floor which made the room quiet. The night shift and early morning staff were the best. Two wonderful and very polite gentleman. The breakfast was good standard italian breakfast: bread, toast, slices of meat, slices of cheese, they had eggs too, cereals, great coffee (the capuccino were a delight/ you have to ask for it though), juice, milk, and a lot of fruits, mermelades and chocolate. I would recommend this lovely hotel to any adult looking for good service, comfort and location.

Reviews.Title: “amazing vacation”
Reviews.Author: dargo17
Reviews.Content: my husband and I stayed at britannia hotel for 8 days for a romantic trip, this hotel is absolutelly wonderful, clean, service excellent , breakfast very good and the staff was great and very helpfull. a must and we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Eastlighter
Reviews.Content: As a result of the April 2010 volcanic ash crisis and resultant flight cancellation we could not return to our original Rome hotel, but that hotel arranged for us to transfer to the Hotel Britannia for 2 nights. It has a good location, near Termini rail station. This hotel was less spacious than the first, but the reception staff were extremely helpful and gave free internet access to allow us to check out alternative ways to travel. They also translated the recorded messages on the Alitalia Helpline which, as time progressed, were totally in Italian (even the 'English option'!). The hotel breakfast was good, with a wide selection. Overall a hotel that provides very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Britannia”
Reviews.Author: BarbraB
Reviews.Content: Our stay was awesome! The views from the rooftop bar were spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Requires attention”
Reviews.Author: Visitorsireland
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for husbands 50th Birthday and advised hotel in advance of celebration and requested nice room!. On arrival -no mention of Birthday and given an average room - very disappointed. Plus points Reception - Curteous Breakfast - adequate with curteous staff Location - close to Via Nationale Negatives Room - Small Bathroom - Shower controller was not working and advised reception - next day only cold water - following day no control over very hot water. Ants in bathroom. Bedroom - small. Not cleaned properly as evidence of previous occupants found under bed!! and on carpet. TV - non existant only english channel CNN.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: goggietheo
Reviews.Content: friendly personnel good breakfast clean rooms close to attractions

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: map831
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 5 nighte before a cruise and all I can say is it was a Great Hotel. Our room was great, we had our own little balcony (which we did not use as much as we would have liked to - only because there is so much to see and do in Rome) . Mario was awesome. Mario at the front desk gave us suggestions for restaurants in the area and everyone of them were great. Bed was very comfortable and room was clean and spacious since we had a little living room area as well. Would go back there again and recommend it to anyone who goes to Rome. Centrally located

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel - one or two minor changes needed”
Reviews.Author: happy_hobbit
Reviews.Content: The Britannia is a nice, characterful hotel, very conveniently located near Repubblica metro station just off the Via Nazionale. (However, DON'T try to get there by Metro from Termini - you're better off walking or - probably - getting a cab, though these are expensive in Rome). We stayed for 5 nights in November and it was a perfect spot for exploring the city. The hotel is quiet, even though it's only around 100 metres from a busy main road. The Anglican church of St Pauls Within the Walls is next door, and is beautiful inside (especially the mosaics and marble pulpits), and hosts lots of classical music concerts. The rooms are not spacious, but perfectly adequate for a city break to Rome. Our 'view' was of a quiet, private side alley - OK, not overly pretty, but then you don't need a view with the whole of Rome on your doorstep. Our room was reasonably well appointed with TV (if you need one), mini-bar, tea & coffee-making facilities, a safe, a chair, a stool, bedside cabinets with a single drawer each and a moderate-sized wardrobe/closet. (There's nowhere to stow suitcases, so take a bag that'll squash pretty flat and slide it uder the bed). There's an OK bathroom with a bidet, and a small fish-tank with 3 fish in it ! The bath has a fixed (rather weak) shower and a separate spray nozzle. Beware, the taps are confusing - the red one fills the bath, the blue ones control the pressure of the 2 showers. Oh, and every bathroom has a complimentary rubber duck! There's free wireless internet - with good service - in the rooms and public areas. The lift is tiny - room for 3 people max or 1 person and 2 suitcases. The stairs are also very narrow, so if you're very large, you may have problems getting to your room! (If you're that big, you'll have problems getting to the hotel - Rome makes few allowances for anyone with mobility issues. Even getting on and off the Leonardo Express between the airport and the city with a suitcase is tricky if you're not reasonably fit and slim!) Breakfasts are excellent. Fresh fruit, a good selection of cereals, fresh walnuts and delicious prunes, a nice range of cold meats & cheeses, bakery goods, plus cooked food including crispy bacon, herby tomatoes and mushrooms, and of course very good coffee. (The only problem is the lack of spoons for cereals, etc - a small but slightly irritating oversight). There's also a bowl of fruit on the landing, so you can take an apple, orange or plum back to your room. We found the service to be very good and friendly from all the staff. They were obliging in printing our boarding passes for the return trip and giving us advice and directions. There were just a couple of things that would improve the hotel. We found the cleaning of the bathrooms somewhat haphazard - soap marks around the basin were still there when we returned after a day's sightseeing, the towels we had elected to re-use were exactly as we'd left them, not re-folded and tidied, etc. (We mentioned this to the guy on reception, and it did improve on our last day - but not much). Also, we'd rather have a shower cap in the bathroom than a rubber duck! Overall, we found the Britannia to be a very good hotel, conveniently located and with nice, attentive service. A couple of minor tweaks would improve it still further. A couple of points - if you want to vivit the Villa Borghese, book in advance. Even though the gallery was almost empty (certainly by UK standards), they wouldn't sell us tickets on the day. The 'Roma Pass' may help, but we didn't think it was worth the money. The Metro is good for the Colosseum and sort of alright for the Vatican (a long walk), but useless for (say) the Pantheon, the Castell Saint Angelo, and (if you've heard of it and can be bothered to make the trek up there), the Tempietto in Gianicolo. Check carefully when everything is open - we saw the Sistene Chapel on the Thursday, but it was (apparently) closed on the Friday, Saturday and Sunday. If you're going this time of year, don't listen to the touts selling you expensive guided tours of the Vatican The lines were non-existent, it closed at 5:30 (NOT 1:45 as advertised) and we spent 5 hours inside - not the 2.5 hours the tours offer. What's more, we found the Sistene Chapel fascinating, but you don't need an hour there. The Map Gallery was, for us, even more spectacular. So save your money, and spend €7 each on an audio guide, and another €7 on the exhausting but amazing climb up the dome of St Peter's.

Reviews.Title: “good location, clean, very nice breakfast”
Reviews.Author: FLYERS49
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a vacation to Rome. The staff was very pleasant and accomodating. Location was very good; walkable to all sites in the city. The room was small, minimalist, clean. The bathroom was very nice and modern. Breakfast was very good - eggs, sweets, meats, good service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean hotel . . but VERY compact”
Reviews.Author: Nodnoltravel
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Britannia is a nice clean hotel, with a central location of teh main road. The rooms are very, very compact, but if you've out most of the time as we were, then it's not a problem. The bathroom is a good size. The internet room is tiny, I'm not joking, it's the size of broom cupboard. When you open the door, it hits the chair ! ! ! Still it's free ,so no complaints. The breakfast is a good continental spread of hot and cold foods. Overall the hotel is in a good location, is clean and the staff helpful. There is a local supermarket nearby also & lots of restaurants to suit all pockets.

Reviews.Title: “Sleep easy knowing you have booked a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Paulandjoan
Reviews.Content: First trip to Rome , travelled with wife and 20 something son and daughter and first holiday as 'family' in many years so wanted everything to be right. Love it or hate it Trip Advisor is useful in making sure you are going to get a good hotel but sometimes the reviews for same hotel are so varied that it looks like a bit of a gamble to book one. Hotel Britannia had constantly good reviews - booking was quick and easy and hotel pre trip response etc was excellent - opted for pick up at airport - well worth it , hassle free and straight to the door. Welcome was great, courtesy drink and very quick check in as a result we settled in quickly and were on the open top bus tour around 2 hrs of arriving at the airport! Rooms were good size , well equipped, comfortable and very clean and well maintained. Breakfast was superb - a well needed early energy boost for the day ahead! Hotel well located - easy walk to main sites of interest - taxi to vatican was 20 minutes and cost 10 Euros (4 people). Staff helpful and friendly - on leaving found that the Italy wide credit card authorisation system had crashed - issue was dealt with efficiently and pro-actively by Enrico at front desk. Definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A gem atop one of the 7 hills of Rome”
Reviews.Author: PaperBoy1
Reviews.Content: What a great visit. Three days in Rome staying at the Britannia before jumping on a cruise ship. The staff was very helpful. The breakfasts were outstanding. We liked the fact that everything we wanted to see was a downhill walk from the hotel. Well, the Vatican was a taxi, but easy walk to Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, Coliseum, and loads of churches and basilicas. Rooms are small but that is typical in Rome. I would highly recommend the Britannia. Surrounded by restaurants, shopping and sites.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay/Great value”
Reviews.Author: JoyAtlanta_GA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Britannia for three nights during our 25th wedding anniversary trip. The hotel was quiet, a great value, and the breakfasts were fabulous! The staff was friendly and helpful and I would highly recommend this hotel. Either walk or take the metro to all the sights as it is also in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place in Roma!”
Reviews.Author: PackRules
Reviews.Content: Awesome. Front desk staff, e.g., Steffania, is super. Nice that they have a few suites so the family can be all together (hard to find in Rome). Rooms are clean, updated and cozy. Breakfast is fantastic, among best we've ever had (and it's included). 10 to 15 min cab ride to all major destinations.

Reviews.Title: “Fntastic Hotel in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Lella1981
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Britannia is a wonderful Hotel in Rome. It is elegant, quiet, the staff is very friendly and you can reach the center in just 5 Minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location and great welcome from all staff”
Reviews.Author: Ziggurat0
Reviews.Content: We stayed here having worked out that the first hotel we had booked was too far out of the centre. Enrico was our initial point of contact and was extremely helpful & courteous. The hotel is small but charming and really well located just off the Via Nazionale - perfect for less noise but still in the centre of everything. Rooms are not large but perfectly adequate & well furnished and finished - this is a city centre hotel after all and is a converted noble residence. Wonderful buffet breakfast with a wide choice of both hot and cold dishes, cereals, juices, tea & coffee. Apart from Enrico, we were also well looked after by Francesca and Mario - these three rotate on front of house and are all helpful, charming and polite. So pleasant to be looked after by people like this in a city where there is plenty of scope to be ripped off. We all loved our stay here and will not need to look any further for other hotels when we next visit Rome - we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Solarium in the bathroom”
Reviews.Author: OsloArne
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a bit different. Especially the bathroom. They had a little plastic duck. And solarium in the ceiling. Believe it or not. The breakfast was was very good. But I stayed in one of the cheapest rooms, and that was an unbeviable small room. Big bed, but almost no floorspace. Free wire-less internet, though.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location with thoughtful and kind staff, esp. Mario and Enrico.”
Reviews.Author: Delgrey
Reviews.Content: This small lovely hotel is off a main street and is centrally located, making it within walking distance to all of the main attractions. If public transportation is needed that, too, is quite convenient to the hotel. The hotel has old world charm with modern amenities. Very quiet. The breakfast that is offered has quite a variety of items. Beds are comfortable and the ac is super! We had 4 in our room which was a bit tight but manageable for 1 week. The staff is very kind, thoughtful, informative, patient, and accommodating always making you feel special. Not having a restaurant on the premises can be a tad inconvenient for those late evenings when you just want to grab something quick and just eat in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Truly above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: fphaynes
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our trip to Rome. We just had to tell everyone how pleased we were with the Britannia Hotel. They were very helpful throughout our entire trip. We had lovely rooms (small by US standards) with beautiful patios outside our rooms. They also have a nice breakfast buffet that consisted of fresh fruits deli meats, chesses, yogurts, cereal, and juices. The location of this hotel was also very nice it is centrally located and only several blocks from the Republica metro stop. The Front desk was very helpful in the booking and giving of directions to the various sites in Rome. The highlight of their suggestions was a wonderful little family owed restaurant near the coliseum. My father had his birthday while we were staying at the Britannia Hotel and the sent up a nice complimentary bottle of wine for him; I thought that was a lovely gesture. The point that I really want to stress about this hotel was after we checked out. We went on a cruise and inquired to the cruise line about shuttles to take us to the airport. The cruise line wanted a ridiculous price, so we e-mailed the Britannia Hotel and they were kind enough to book and transfer for the ship for us at a much lower price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very helpful staff, nice facilities, GREAT breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: D0N623
Reviews.Content: I researched many hotels online and settled on Britannia Hotel. We're glad we did. During my research, I emailed the staff about the hotel, the area, safety, proximity to major sites, etc. They were very, very helpful and I could not be happier. When you look at the hotel picture, our room was the one with the little balcony on the front corner of the building. While the modern room and bath were small, the balcony more than made up for it. Our only complaint was that the TV in the room was rather small! Ha! A very minor consideration since we only watched while getting ready to go out or to bed!!!! The location was great. We walked about 2 blocks to the subway and could go anywhere in a few minutes. The hotel is on a small and narrow side street just off a major shopping area. It was great area to stroll in the early evening to get gelatto! We can't say enough about the staff. Very, very helpful and accommodating. You can buy tours, bus tickets, etc from them. Breakfast was incredible.

Reviews.Title: “small rooms, loved the breakfast, helpful staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: Lynee
Reviews.Content: stayed last year (so a bit late in reviewing!) but can still remember it - so must be OK! Room on the small side (with fish tank!) but comfy bed and good bathroom (with little rubber duck!). Breakfast was great - the scrambled eggs and porcini mushrooms - yum! Staff very friendly and helpful. Lift is TINY!!! Quite funny trying to fit luggage and people...may have to wait your turn. Location good... we pretty much walked everywhere but metro is close by anyway and can grab a bus easily. Good stuff!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Barrypaul
Reviews.Content: Great location, warm friendly staff (they let us check in early which was a major plus after flying all night). Room was small, typical from other feedback, but it was quiet and very clean. We walked to all the sights including the train station when we departed, location was a plus. Breakfast was outstanding. If your tipping the scales over 300, you might not fit in the elevator but that may be the least of your worries!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Good Value, Amazing Buffet, Smallish Room”
Reviews.Author: Gaetano_007
Reviews.Content: Also, the location is perfect if you need to be near Termini Station. A good value at under 200 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and very helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: Kenfaisey
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three night stay at the Britannia which proved a good base for exploring Rome, Plus points were good access to transport, Termini etc, convenient walking distance to many of the main attractions and friendly and helpful staff. Negatives which have all been commented on by others were the smallish size of the rooms and the cost for the facilities available. Rome is now a very expensive city and the hotel is right in the centre but nevertheless 200 Euros a night for a hotel that is no more than 3 star is a bit steep. Reception staff though were unfailingly helpful including arranging a room move for us to a higher floor with more natural light and the hotel tries hard with fish tanks in each room, plastic ducks and bamboo plants to create an individual atmosphere which mainly succeeds. We all made use of the Irish Bar on the opposite side of the road which runs a happy hour from 7-8 each evening. This reduces the price of a pint from 6 to 4.8 Euro. Handy supermarket as well at the other end of Via Napoli which has a wide range of food and drinks at reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: afrancisco
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my husband for 1 week in March 2009. We arrived very early on a sunday and were brought straight to an available room with no wait. The room was a perfect size for us, and the sound proof walls made it feel as if we were the only ones on the floor the whole week. The breakfast was perfect for our needs, and as we were usually the first ones to arrive we never had to wait for a seat. We filled up on breakfast and usually had a very light lunch in the afternoon. Staff was always courteous and provided us with everything we needed during our stay. If we stayed out late, they would leave mints on our pillows and a note of the weather forecast for the next day. The location of the hotel was wonderful, down via viminale are at least 7 restaurants that serve high quality dinner, a gelateria, a supermarket, and a coffee bar that served fresh pizza and pasta at all hours (even on a sunday). Before our trip we utilized google maps and could view street view pictures of the location and easily navigated the area upon arrival. Local attractions less than a few blocks away include the roman opera house (wonderful experience), national museum of rome (palazzo massimo), and the baths of diocletian. We never used a taxi or the subway during our entire trip, and utlized a hop-on hop off bus to get a tour on our way to St. Peters Square. Overall it was a wonderful week and I would stay at Hotel Britannia again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value...good location.”
Reviews.Author: RCH3
Reviews.Content: Good location within walking distance of Termini. Hotel is on a quiet street near Republica. We were on the first floor facing the street, but we couldn't hear a thing at night courtesy of the double-paned windows. Quite unexpected. The hotel was very family friendly, and they had made up a special bed for our 2-year-old daughter before we arrived. There was even a little rubber ducky waiting in the bathtub--nice touch. There was also a free breakfast buffet that was quite extensive (meats, cheeses, pastries, cereals, fresh fruits, eggs, bacon, etc).

Reviews.Title: “Like everything else in Rome, not value for money (except public transport)”
Reviews.Author: Nev1947
Reviews.Content: The best feature of this hotel is its location in a quiet side-street off Via Natzionale. Room was extremely compact (less than 4 metres square plus bathroom). No drawers, just hanging cupboards but staff pleasant. On arrival we were offered 10% off the agreed terms if we paid in cash! Nothing like a UK 4 star hotel, breakfast boringly average.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel that makes you feel at home.”
Reviews.Author: plove1948
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from yet another trip to Rome this time staying at the Hotel Britannia. It is located a short walk from Termini and Via Nazionale. It is centrally located for the person that wants to use the busses, trains or walk. The people are wonderful . As you are checking in they bring you fresh juice and cookies. In each room there is a fishbowl on the desk that make you feel like you are in a home not a hotel.They also turn down your bed at night and leasve not only chocolate but a card with the weather for the next day .There is also fresh fruit on every floor for your taking. It is the little extra touch that makes this hotel a gem We had an early departure and would not be there for breakfast and they graciously told us to take some items with us for the trip. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty and clean, personable and safe local... and big free breakfast too!”
Reviews.Author: tumbleweedman
Reviews.Content: I first heard about this hotel through Rick Steves' Italy guide book and it was right on the mark in terms of being extra welcoming to English speaking guests. Mario Teti, the receptionist, was incredibly helpful and caring... something you won't always find in Roma. Another thing you rarely find in Roma is large rooms... but this hotel has great size rooms. I loved it! I felt like I was staying with friends. I would definitely stay again and recommend to anyone. Absolutely, without a doubt. Thanx again Hotel Britannia.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, excellent breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: ViviTelAviv
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights, enjoyed the wonderful breakfast served in the nicest dishes, the roon (thogh rather small) was elegentelly furnished and very clean, the stuff was attentive and the location excellant. we'll recommand this hotel to all our freinds.

Reviews.Title: “rome was amazing”
Reviews.Author: muttibolton
Reviews.Content: Hotel britannia was quite good, the room was small but adequate for our needs, as we were out most of the day sightseeing. Dissappointed to say the least after reading the reviews on trip advisor, I found the reception staff to be quite aloof and not at all interested in our needs, at no point were we asked if we needed any advise on tours, places to visit, resteraunts etc. In actual fact the most we got out of them was an answer to our "good Morning or Good Evening". Breakfast was excellent, a really good choice of everything, the room was kept clean and the chambermaid was most friendly, in actual fact more friendly than the reception staff. I would suggest you do not use anything from the mini bar in the room, it costs an absolute fortune, go to the local supermarket at the end of via napoli and buy your beers and wine there. Maybe we would stay at this hotel again (the breakfast swung it for us). But I think a little more thought in advising guests who are on a city sightseeing tour of places to see and eat would help enormously.

Reviews.Title: “Nice centrally-located small hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: YJScq
Reviews.Content: I booked the Britannia based on its location, the fact that it included a full breakfast, and that it had free WiFi in the rooms. The hotel is near the intersection of Via Napoli with Via Nazionale, 2 minutes by foot from the Piazza Della Repubblica, and 5 minutes from the Termini station. If you like walking you can easily get to many of the standard attractions by foot, otherwise it is easy to catch a bus nearby. Next door is an Anglican church which holds concerts. Upon checking in you are treated to a complimentary hot drink - I took a Cappuccino and my wife had a hot chocolate - just what we needed considering the cold outside. I had asked for an early checkin (nominal time 13:00), and indeed a room was available for us at 10:00. Our room was one of the few with a balcony, which was definitely a plus despite the cold weather. The room was relatively small but comfortable and with plenty of light. There is a minibar refrigerator and an electric kettle, and the coffee and teabags (including my wife's favorite - Earl Gray) are provided daily. We had to ask for the sheets not to be changed daily, and if you are out late the room is checked again and hard candies placed on the pillows. Every morning a printed 1-page world-news review is slipped under the door, and in the evening a handwritten card with the next day's weather and sunset time. There is essentially no lobby, just the 8-table breakfast room, the 4 table bar area, and a small niche. On each floor there is a corner with a sofa and a small table with fresh fruit. The WiFi coverage was less than satisfactory. The entrance floor has a WPA-secured network which worked well, but the other floors were covered by a single access point with a limited number of IP-address leases. In our room the signal strength was often very low, and the connection would drop after 10 minutes use. After such a drop I frequently could not reconnect due to there no longer being available leases. My wife was quite happy that this restricted my email browsing time, but less so that Skype to family was not reliable. The staff was courteous and friendly. We stayed 10 days and completely enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IowaChocolatier
Reviews.Content: This lovely boutique hotel is close to the train station and within walking distance of many of the tourist sites and great restaurants and shopping. The receptionists were very helpful. The breakfast was great and the room was well appointed. This was my first trip to Europe and I loved the craziness of Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: jetlagdori
Reviews.Content: Spent 6 days in Rome and this hotel staff was not only friendly but helpful in securing same day reservations to Galleria Borghese and restaurants. Mario and Magdalena were great !The buffet breakfast is surperb that has to appeal to all tastes. Hotel is a ten minute walk to Termini and 5 minutes to Republicca train stations. Hotel is on a quiet street and despite being fully occupied never heard any other guests.There's an internet cafe across the street and cost 2 dollars for half hour access.

Reviews.Title: “Truely a home away from home”
Reviews.Author: MichelleLLoretdeMar
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter 14 and I travelled to Rome and stayed at this litlle hotel having had one of the best impressions on accomodation, we felt at all times welcome, taken care of, expectant of the next detail the hotel staff would have in stock for us... Britannia is an elegant and comfortable Hotel where space is intelligently conceived and detail shows the love for the profession and towartds the wellbeing of the client. Congratulations to the management and staff and also to future guests, the best choice without a doubt. Location is excellent 2 to 8 minutes in any direction by foot to get main streets or transports, (8 minutes walk to Termini, 4 to bus stop, 15 walking to Trevi, or to Colosseum...) Breakfast complete and good quality, fruit, eggs, yogurts, cereals, breads, pastrys, cheeses, sausages, italian ham, coffee EXCELLENT! Bedrooms well structured, small cosy, extremely cofortable beds. Bathroom totally equiped, even with fish, staff at your service always with a smile...what else can one ask for when away from home for any reason? I wish I can one day go back...must be possible....I throwed sooo many coins in the Trevi Foutain!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect litlle place in Rome”
Reviews.Author: bellucciBerlin
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure to stay at the Britannia six days during a two week stay in Rome. It's a wonderful little hotel. I was there on business and know Rome rather well, so I did not need much help or advice, but another hotel guest told me: "they do everything for you. Everything!". That prooved to be true when the car of a guest broke down in front of the hotel. The staff is very friendly, especially Mario is the perfect receptionist to have around. Breakfast is good, the minibar is not too pricy. There's a bowl with fresh fruit on every floor. Rooms are small, but clean and pretty, the fish in the tiny aquarium keep good company... I hope they forgive me for taking the little rubber ducky home! After six days I had to move to 5 star hotel near Via Veneto that had been booked for me - but I honestly would rather have stayed here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small hotel with outstanding staff & facilities”
Reviews.Author: martin9040
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Britannia for 3 nights during the middle of October in 2008. Rooms were very clean and maintained in that manner on a daily basis. In fact, several times, after returing to our room from a short excursion, we found that the staff had noticed our absense and "re-straightened" the room while we were exploring nearby. The morning breakfast was excellent with both American and European styles to choose from. Served between 0730-1030, it was, by far, the best offered by any of the hotels we stayed in during our 9 day journey through Italy. The American coffee was also a blessing. The bathrooms were small, but very clean and maintained throughout our stay. Hot water was never in short supply Everyone on the staff went out of there way to accomodate our every request during the 3 days. One of the members in our group was utilizing a combination of crutches and wheelchair for mobility - not an easy task in a city like Rome. The staff were gracious enough to accomodate her every need during our stay. The area around the hotel appeared to be safe at all times of the day and night. Never once did we observe anything that would counter those feelings relative to the safety of the neighborhood. The hotel was very close to and within reasonable walking distance of the Metro, the train station, and nearby taxi stands. We would definitely stay at the hotel Britannia on any return trips to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “What a lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: italylover29
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Britannia for three nigths in October. It is a lovely hotel with friendly and knowledgeable staff. They provided us with excellent advice and are clealry proud of their beautiful city. The rooms arer small but perfectly proportioned and there is everything that one would need to be very comfortable. The great extras were appreciated. This is excellent value for money and I would recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mmmiami
Reviews.Content: I enjoy my stay at this hotel , my friend and I stay there for 3 days and we felt like home, Mario the receptionist was super kind, they took well care of us, the breakfast was very nice, exellent capuccino,. the location is perfect. I will recomend this hotel ...

Reviews.Title: “Charm in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Good2Go_8
Reviews.Content: A charming hotel. A little off the beaten bath with regards to the top tourist attractions but convenient to the train station (too far to walk unless you are packing lite). Helpful front desk, a little british flavor in Rome. Rooms are snug but with nice amenities and decor.

Reviews.Title: “Rome Britania staff is delightful”
Reviews.Author: pmb436
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend the Hotel Brittania if you are looking for a lovely, small hotel with a staff that will take excellent care of your every need while in Rome. We were greeted warmly in the charming lobby with a tray full of iced drinks, invaluable on this hot day. The hotel is air conditioned, the rooms are well appointed, comfortable and charming. Most importantly, not only had the staff taken care of all of our requests prior to arriving, they gently suggested improvements to our itinerary and dining choices that made our experience even better than we had planned for. If you visit, be sure to ask Mario to set up a dining experience for you at his favorite restaurant, we had a great meal and special attention was paid to us as if we were regular customers and old friends.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cbailward
Reviews.Content: Small double room with no view but comfortable bed and, unusually, a bathtub with shower over. The staff were all very friendly and helpful from our arrival from the airport via Termini station at about 11pm until we left after 3 nights stay. The breakfast is a real plus, catering for all tastes from fruit , yoghurt and muesli to eggs and bacon: the scrambled egg was particularly good. The hotel is easy to find, down a side street and, in our experience, quiet, though there is a popular Irish Bar just across the road. There are bus-stops within 200 yards and Termini station is about 5 minutes walk. The neighbourhood is quite salubrious and we did not feel at all threatened when returning late at night. Like all cities Rome has its fair share of vagrants but it semed no worse than central London. I did a lot of research before leaving the UK and, although the hotel is not cheap it seems to be reasonable value for money in Rome. Anyone travelling to Rome is well advised to take advantage of the Roma Pass which can be bought from most tobacconists. It gives you unlimited travel on public transport for 3 days and free entry into 2 museums with discounted entry thereafter. Entry to the Colosseum/Forum and the Villa Borghese is more than the cost of the Roma Pass so all your transport is free!

Reviews.Title: “The Britannia Hotel is Great!”
Reviews.Author: wrgCalifornia
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Britannia Hotel. We were greeted upon arrival with refreshments and very pleasant staff at the reception desk. The hotel is ideally located on a quiet side street within walking distance of the train station, the Roman Forum and the metro line. The rooms are attractive and adequately sized and the included breakfast was the most generous and attractive of all those we were offered in Italy. The hotel desk staff was fluent in English and most accommodating in helping us arrange for tours, a car and driver to take us back and forth to our cruise ship in Civitivecchia and to the airport, and recommending excellent restaurants for dinner. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: NoNameTrvlr
Reviews.Content: Britannia Hotel is a nice hotel on a quiet side street (via Napoli) near the main train station and metro line and within walking distance to the Colosseum and Roman ruins. My husband and I stayed in a junior suite, Room 403. Mario at reception was extremely helpful in making airport transfer arrangements and restaurant recommendations. The room was very clean but the furnishings are a bit dated. The bed was very firm - good for my husband's bad back. Because it was a suite it was large by european standards with enough storage space. The marble bathroom was a nice size with a sun lamp in the shower but the tub/shower was rather narrow. The nice sized terrace was a real plus. We even got the NCAA Final Four on the satellite TV. Breakfast included bacon/eggs/sausage along with the typical italian meats, fruit, pastries. The only negative was an odor in the room occasionally but we opened the window and it quickly aired out. Although not my first choice of hotels originally, I would definitely go back because we really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Place to Stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: italytraveler13
Reviews.Content: The Britannia hotel is very well situated, one block off of the via Nationale, near the Piazza Republica and the Termini train station. So, access to buses and subways is excellent. The best reason for staying at the Britannia, however, is the excellent staff and the genuine concern that they have for the comfort of their guests. Every request for assistance was met with a smile and an efficient response. The rooms are very clean and relatively spacious. The breakfast buffet was wonderful, with a selection that is second to none. I would not hesitate to stay here again on our next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “lovely, small hotel”
Reviews.Author: johnbachel
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Britannia. Although the room was not large, but it was clean and had a good bathroom. The staff was helpful and the continental breakfast had many good options.

Reviews.Title: “Please go to this Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Jet_Setter_0
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Britannia for 3 nights from 26th Jan 2008. Before booking our trip I researched the internet to find the best hotel in the most convenient location. After a long long search I booked this hotel and all I can say is that we found our stay fantastic. The hotel is very close to the main train station, very close to the nearest metro station and close enough to walk to all the sights and back again each day. The room was spacious, spotless and the bathroom had a Jacuzzi – which was very welcome after a day of sightseeing. As with all my holidays, I scour tripadvisor before I travel to any hotel to get a feel of the place – I particually look for anything bad that is said about the Hotel to get a true picture of the Hotel – But I cannot say anything bad about our experiance (and I have thought about it!!). You do not need to hear my comments regarding Rome – it is simply breathtaking!! In Summary Rooms - Clean Breakfast - Fantastic Bed - Comfy For 3 Nights what more do you need?? One last point, it was my birthday whilst we were there and on our return to our room there was a bottle of Champagne awaiting us and a card wishing me well – I though that was such a nice touch. Even if they did not do this my review would still be the same. So thank you to all the staff and the Britannia for making our stay even more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel staff”
Reviews.Author: LovTaTravelNY
Reviews.Content: As soon as we arrived we were greeted by the friendly staff of this wonderful hotel. Travelling in Italy in July can be very tiring and exhausting. As soon as we went to check in, we were handed cold drinks and biscotti. The front desk booked our day tours of Rome and made reservations at local restaurants for us. The room was great and yes there will be a fish waiting for you in the room. Breakfast was good. Hotel A+.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled”
Reviews.Author: thewwanderer
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a weekend in Rome and have never been bothered about writing a review before, but I was so horrified by the fact that my experience bore no relation to many of the reviews that I wanted to share them. The hotel is in a central location, the staff are helpful and friendly and the rooms are clean but that really is where the good stuff stops. Our room was miniscule, there was a double bed and only really enough room to walk around it. The bathroom was a good size but the shower was pretty ineffective (although plenty of hot water). The fish are a bit of a gimmick really, nice but frankly for 300 Euro a room I would prefer more space. The bed was diabolical, you rolled into the middle as the mattress was pretty old and the décor is very tired. They claim the rooms are soundproofed, but we could literally hear our neighbours farting! Breakfast was nice enough but nothing out of the ordinary. We tried to have a drink in the bar one night, no presecco (it was only Italy after all) and the alternatives were served with some seriously out of date peanuts……. Suffice it to say that the Brittania is fine, nothing special and seriously overpriced for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a city break”
Reviews.Author: jayjaygee
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel early and checked straight in. We were offered juice and cookies and our case was taken up to our room. Our room, 307, was small but had a huge comfy bed and a good size bathroom with plenty of hot water. We had a tank of fish and a rubber duck!! Tea and coffee making facilities. The location was ideal for us. We only had 2 nights and three days and found it easy to get to the Colisseum, Forum,Vatican, Trevi Fountain,Pantheon,Palitone and used the number 64 bus which ran along the via Nazionale at the end of the street.The staff were very helpful and we appreciated the big bowls of fruit. The Irish pub on the corner was good and we found a super little pizzeria a couple of roads away called Riccis-excellent . Cheap wine and great atmosphere and pizzas.. We managed to see a lot of the sights and were not disappointed at all. I recommend this hotel for a great city break. Oh I almost forgot, breakfast was very good with lovely melon, hams, eggs etc etc etc.

Reviews.Title: “Rome”
Reviews.Author: ShawBristol
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel. Some of the standard rooms are a bit small so worth getting a superior room for a little bit more as these are big. Got one of the smaller rooms when booked through expedia so upgraded and was much better. Good hotel all round otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Britannia Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rimma1924
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Britannia early September, 07. It was a very pleasant stay. Hotel has a very convenient location: walking to Termini, walking or taking a bus down via Nazionale to Forum and Coliseum. Subway is around the corner and takes you to Vatican or wherever else you want to go. Staff is excellent. Breakfast - the best! Can't forget those sauted porchinies. Great variety of cold cuts, cereals, you name it. Very tasty. If we come back to Rome, will stay here again. Have to mention - we got a rate of USD 168/night through Expedia. I don't think you can beat that for early September in Rome. We also requested early arrival. We arrived to Britannia at Noon and got our room right away. Also - our room was exactly as on the pictures. It was not huge, but convenient with nice decour.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay at the Britannia”
Reviews.Author: wolfman613
Reviews.Content: We just returned from four days in Rome. We stayed at the Britannia Hotel and were very pleased with the location, service and cleanliness at this hotel. It was very hot in Rome in August and as a result the air conditioning was not cooling off our room sufficiently on our first night. We mentioned this to the concierge in the morning and he immediately offered to move us to another room, where the air conditioning worked just fine. The breakfasts were great and the presence of a basket of fresh fruit on each floor (constantly refilled) added a very nice touch. There is a computer with high speed access that is available for use by the guests of the hotel at no additoonal fee. I found the concierge (who has been at this hotel for 30 years) to be very helpful and knowledgeable. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A well kept, charming and convenient place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: piggyinthemiddle1961
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our two teenagers for 4 nights in early July and loved it. This place is well located and has class. The furnishings are very nice, marble bathroom, thick towels, nice linens. Wonderful buffet for breakfast with something for everybody and good coffee, Management extremely helpful an friendly. Many places within easy walking distance and the subway and trainstation are a short walk for day trips. Airconditioning was a lifesaver in the heat. Quiet rooms good for getting over jet lag. Our room for four had a wonderful little terrace with potted plants that seemed like it was not in the middle of a busy city. I would stay here again and recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: onwis
Reviews.Content: I have to say that I was one of those people who worried about staying in a bad location in Rome or being too far away from the sites but my extensive research led me to Hotel Britannia, where we had a wonderful stay. I really couldn't have asked for much more. The hotel was well-kept and clean. The bed was comfortable and we had air conditioning which was a plus in the July heat. The staff was helpful guiding us to some great restaurants within walking distance of the hotel. We were able to walk easily to all of the sites (including the Vatican). Plus it is one block off of Nationale which is a wonderful shopping area. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: rosyko
Reviews.Content: The service is simply wonderful at Britannia. When we first arrive, we were greeted with some fresh juices and cookies. Each room, although slightly small, is nevertheless nicely decorated. The hotel also provides fresh seasonal fruits throughout the day for guests (not just your ordinary oranges, apples and bananas). The breakfast has a great quality food. The hotel is located right off Via Nationale and is just minutes away from the Termini train station. During our stay in Rome, we took a short trip to Bologna, and staying at the hotel makes life a lot easier

Reviews.Title: “Well Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Bishbj
Reviews.Content: We were warmly welcomed by friendly reception staff and were offered a glass of juice whilst checking in, which was a nice touch after a longs days traveling. Our room was a good size for European standards, our bed was firm and almost if not king size. There was a small area with a writing desk and mini bar. We also had a little friend, a fish that kept us company. As stated in other reviews the bathroom was quite big, with a shower over bath set up. Breakfast was plentiful, but basic. There was a selection of pastries, cold cuts, breakfast cereals, fruit and a few hot dishes. It was nice to see that the hotel website was accurate with its description about the rooms and services. When we have the opportunity to come back to Rome, we will return back to this quaint hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Hel5London
Reviews.Content: Hotel is situated about 5 mins walk from Termini. Termini is like every other city mainline station. Not very pleasant. But as soon as you leave the immediate vicinity everything is fine. The hotel's location was not a problem. Rome is not a big city. We walked to the Vatican City in 45 minutes. All sites easily reached on foot. Bus service also excellent. The hotel itself is clean, very comfortable and well maintained. The staff are polite and helpful. The travellers' candid photos already posted on this site are accurate. Rooms are spacious (unusual for Rome). We even had a little terrrace adjoining our room which would be fantastic for summer evenings. This hotel is highly recommended. We would definitely stay here again when we return to Rome (which we will).

Reviews.Title: “Thin walls, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: RoyNYC
Reviews.Content: Overall, a fine hotel with great service and nice ammenities for its price range. The location may not be convenient for many tourists and the rooms are not for light sleepers. Location: The hotel is very close to Termini Station, Rome's main train station. That makes it convenient for arriving and departing by train or air. However, very few of the attractions, quality restaurants or worthwhile streets are in this area. The neighborhood near the station is also known to be the only area of questionable safety in the city. So while the block of the hotel may be OK, know that you dont want to go exploring the area at night. - Do stay here if your trip to Rome will be for only one day, and therefore worth staying somewhere that is easy for arriving and departing the city. - Do not stay here if your trip is longer than a day and you plan on doing plenty of walking around and exploring. The hotel is not a convenient 'home base.' Rooms: The hotel offers nicely appointed rooms for its price range. The bathroom was large for Europe. However, the walls are very thin. You can hear other people talking and I kept hearing the water running through pipes in the walls. I tried going to sleep early, but kept getting woken up by the pipes and neighbors' talking. - Do not stay here if you are a light sleeper. Service: The service was great. The hotel has a very professional staff that was courteous and proper. For example, while I checked in someone from the breakfast room came by and brought me a glass of juice and a cookie. In fact, everyone I encountered working there was extremely friendly and polite.

Reviews.Title: “Britannia - Great !”
Reviews.Author: lostalot
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated approximately five minutes walk from the Termini Railway station and bus drop-off point from the airport and in a quiet side street 50 yards off the main Via Nationale - central for walking to the sights, shopping, restaurants and travel to and from the airport/rail system. I read in previous reviews that the area in which the hotel was situated was less than ideal, especially at night - my wife and I walked throughout the district at most times and met no difficulties whatsoever. Staff are polite and helpful, the premises beautifully appointed, clean and quiet with a convenient small bar and breakfast room available next to reception. The double room which we booked was pefect for two people with a large comfy double bed, TV, AC and mirrored/granite bathroom. Housekeeping ensured that the room was kept at a very high standard every day. The pillow "packages" left daily were also a very nice touch. The hotel is not the cheapest (are there any cheap hotels in Rome!?) but good value for money. I have no criticism of the hotel at all - we enjoyed our stay very much indeed and the location (it is almost directly opposite the best Irish pub in Rome, if this is what you want) was ideal for our break in this fascinating city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: drisky1
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at this hotel when we were in Rome for the Italy v Ireland six nations match. The hotel is fantastically located being only a 10 minute walk from the Termini and only a 5 minute walk from the nearest underground station. Being situated down a side street, the hotel was very quiet and we both slept very soundly. I can't fault the hotel in anyway - the decor was really nice, the staff were very pleasant and spoke very good English, breakfast was good and the rooms were clean and certainly large enough. As far as site seeing went, the Forum and the Coloseum were only a leisurely 25 minute walk away. There's a good Irish Bar just across the road and plenty of bars, restaurants and shops nearby. I'll definitely stay at the Britannia on our next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here....a great city center hotel”
Reviews.Author: RUBE
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for 4 nights along with two friends of ours. I am dubious of city center hotels as previous experience indicates they are shabby and small, this is not the case at The Britannia. I would rate this as a 4 star hotel. Following a 10 minute walk from Termini Station we were very warmly welcomed with drinks and biscuits. Booking in was straight forward and quick and our luggage quickly appeared in our room. Our friends were given a room with a balcony but we requested a quiet room and were given a lovely room at the back of the hotel. I can understand others describing these rooms as small, ours was fine with a almost separate 'dressing' area and the bathroom was huge, including the fish bowl. I have never slept so well at a hotel, it was a quiet location (apart from our female American neighbour!). Breakfast was lovely, just enough choice for us and no complaints about the quality except the toaster needed a couple of goes to produce proper toast. Coffee and tea are plentiful with a large pot per person. Generally it was extremely clean, quiet and some very good luxury touches. You cannot beat the location....especially if you enjoy Irish bars (one within 40 metres). All staff were very helpful and friendly. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Can't say enough nice things about the Britannia!”
Reviews.Author: RomeFirstTimer
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Britannia for 7 nights in February, 2007. Having been burned in the past by making reservations online for hotels we were unfamiliar with, I was really crossing my fingers that it would be as nice as it looked. I'm happy to say that the Britannia was an excellent choice. The room was very comfortable (yes, small by American standards, but that's to be expected), and the bathroom was the most comfortable I've experienced in a European hotel. The room had everything we could have needed, and the bed was surprisingly large (almost king size), and firm, and the pillows were even nice (not those thin feather ones you sink right through). We were also pleasantly surprised by the evening turndown service. The breakfast was always fresh, and there were plenty of choices. The only noise we ever heard was other guests in the hall as they came or went, but you'll hear that anywhere. We didn't even hear the elevator, and our room was more or less right behind it. The location was also great, right by a subway station and Termini, the big train station. By looking at a map of Rome, I had thought we would need to use buses to get to some of the sites such as Trevi Fountain or the Pantheon, but that turned out not to be the case - both are an easy walk from the Britannia (Rome is much more compact than I realized). But by far, the aspect we appreciated the most, was the helpfulness of the front desk staff. They were attentive and friendly, and very willing to help with tours, reservations, phone calls, and restaurant recommendations. Knowing we could rely on them made our stay in Rome so much easier and less stressful. I'll say it again - I can't say enough nice things about this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: ScottNewHampshire
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent six nights at the Hotel Britannia in January 2007. We found the hotel to be very safe and clean. The staff were friendly, helpful and more than happy to assist with dinner plans, transportation to the airport, tours and information. Our room was surprisingly large with private bathroom. Cost $130 euros a night was more than reasonable considering other hotels I researched in Rome. The location of the hotel was perfect, close to many sights withing walkig distance such as Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Forum, Coliseum, Via Nazionale and Metro. We rode the subway all over the city, felt safe but also very aware of our surroundings at all times.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: FrequentDeltaFlyer
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on complimentary reviews on Trip Advisor and was very disappointed. My room was extremely small - so small, I could hardly find a spot on the floor large enough to open my suitcase. Unlike the other descriptions of bathrooms that I read here, which sounded very nice, mine was ugly, old, chipped gray tile and had no hair dryer, something I've not come across before in a hotel of this category. The walls are very thin. The head of my bed was against a wall and apparently on the other side of the wall was my neighbor's bathroom. I was jet-lagged and wanted to sleep late but had no choice but to wake when my neighbors did and then listen to them shower. On the positive side, the staff are lovely, bowls of fresh fruit in the hallway is a nice touch and the breakfast was adequate but I have seen much nicer breakfasts at other four-star hotels. I would not choose to stay here again and would not recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: margaretlb
Reviews.Content: My sister and I spent a very comfortable 5 nights at the Britannia Hotel in mid October. The location right off of via Nazioanale and 4 blocks from Termini was convenient for us. The hotel has old world charm and a very friendly staff. The room (215) was large with very comfortable beds and a private terrace with table and two chairs. The room decor is also lovely with heavy satin drapes and art photos that are attractive. Also, a little fish "to keep you company". The bathroom is modern with good hot water. Really good lighting in both the room and bathroom. Spotlessly clean and freshly pressed sheets daily. The included breakfast is first class with many hot and cold options: eggs, frittata, bacon, sausage, beans, cheeses, cold meats, fresh fruit salads, many fresh baked goods, the best coffee I've had in Europe. Twice, because of early morning appointments, we had breakfast in our room and there was only a E2.50 sucharge for the room service (no charge for the breakfast). I used a phone card for calls and there was no charge, not even a connection charge. You also can control both the air and heat. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: CeeGee
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised by the rooms, breakfast and staff. Initially we choose this hotel because we needed to be closer to the train station but we also enjoyed the area's great shopping and proximity to Quirinale and Via Veneto. We were able to walk to Ancient Rome and the Forum.

Reviews.Title: “loved Hotel Britania”
Reviews.Author: stevegolf
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Britania for 2 nights. Great location-central to all of Rome, walking distance to the train station. Lots of great stores and restaurants within walking distance. I agree the Hotel's street is not so beautiful but the general area is very nice- you're in the shopping/business district of downtown Rome. However there are nicer areas of Rome - near the spanish steps and trevi fountain. Hotels in these areas would probably be more expensive. The staff of the Britania could not have been nicer or more helpful. Breakfasts were excellent much more than the usual hotel fair- full buffet including hot entrees such as eggs, waffles, veggies, pasta. The breakfast area was very pleasant and comfortable. There is a cosy small bar/lounge opposite the breakfast room. The Rooms were very nice but small like most european hotels. They were very quiet because the Hotel is on a side street and there are double windows. The baths were clean and very nice-marble of course. I believe this hotel is a great value- if you like small charming hotels this is a great place. Because it was not in a charming area, I could not give it five stars.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but no more”
Reviews.Author: kutzsche
Reviews.Content: The hotel is generally nice with two expceptions: The rooms are small (we had a standard double) and the hotel is too pricey for what it offers. It's looked centrally but down a small ugly side street, and you can see the wear and tear of the hotel everywhere, from the rooms to the lobby, the elevator etc. On the positive side the breakfast was excellent and the service was very good as well. Overall, we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but some bedrooms are extremely small!”
Reviews.Author: AnnaD
Reviews.Content: A nice enough hotel in a central location. I was just a bit dissapointed as I had booked a double room but was given a twin one, and simply told that all of the doubles were booked up. The room was nicely furnished with comfortable beds but was very, very small! We were probably just unlucky though as by looking at the rooms on the website, most of them look a good size. On the whole, we had a pleasant stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Little Jenny
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from this hotel. It is within easy reach of Rome's main station and the Coloseum and is a good base for exploring the city. On arrival at the hotel we were given a drink and biscuits which was a nice touch and we were shown to our room and given an explanation of where everything was and how it all worked. We had a nice room with a balcony and my son loved the pet fish in the room. The breakfasts here are excellent and they have a particularly good selection for making your own cereal with lots of different nuts and dried friuts - although one word of caution - the dining room is small and so sometimes you have to wait for a table and if you still are eating your breakfast at 10am when it officially finishes the lights over the food go out! The area around the hotel seemed fine - especially the Via Nationale end where there are some good shops and restaurants. If you are staying at this hotel I would not advise eating at the Irish pub on the corner - we had a meal there on our first night and I had a beef dish - the meat was inedible - had I been in the UK I would have refused to pay for it! Also beware of prices at restaurants in key locations such as Piazza Navona - the prices of the main dishes are reasonable but they over charge for drinks and ice creams and you can end up with an extortionate bill for a mediocre meal - albeit in great surroundings. Finally I would like to add that I last stayed in Rome on my honeymoon in 1987 and the city has greatly improved over the last 19 years. It is much cleaner with less grafiti and there seemed to be less evidence of pickpockets and crime in general and a more visable police presence. A particular area that has improved is Termini station which used to be beset by pickpockets and is now much improved although still has a few beggers. Others improvements include Piazza Del Popolo which is no longer used as a car park and Rome zoo which has had a major facelift.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: CharEms
Reviews.Content: A really lovely hotel, we booked through easyhotels(--) and had no problems at all. It's near to a tube station which is useful, although they stop quite early and only cover some of Rome, so you end up walking most places. The room was fairly small, but did us fine, (we're two female friends) and there's a small fish in every room which is sweet. The staff were all very friendly and breakfast was yummy, plenty to choose from. I'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Overlooked little gem”
Reviews.Author: abettel
Reviews.Content: This is a smart, reasonably priced, well-situated choice for a 1-2 night stay. Courteous staff, nice breakfast buffet and handy to the central train station and many of the city's sights.

Reviews.Title: “An Enjoyable Overnight Stay”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel023
Reviews.Content: I spent one night here in late June, 2006. I arrived around 10:30 p.m. and found Maddalena the receptionist and the night receptionist waiting to welcome me, concerned that I should have been there a few hours prior. A porter was available to carry my bags down the five or so stairs to the desk and up to street level the next day after checkout. My single room was small but quite lovely and accommodating to a single female traveler. The high ceilings helped. The bathroom was great - all mirrors, and had the wonderful added touch of a fish tank with a lone fish to keep me company. Breakfast was more like lunch, with eggs, bacon, assorted cold meats, fruit, rolls, and salads. Very good, and all in all a great experience - I wish I could have spent more time there. The hotel is approximately 10-15 minutes walking distance from Stazione Termini. I walked from the station (since the airport ATMs would not accept my bank card & I had a very limited amount of Euros for a cab). Although it was around 10 p.m. and the streets did not have many pedestrians, I felt relatively safe. I had to stop twice to ask directions because I couldn't find the street signs I was looking for. Everyone I asked was extremely kind and helpful, with one hotel desk clerk watching me until I got to the end of his street and an Internet store clerk walking me around the block to Via Napoli & offering to walk me down the end of it to the hotel. However, I suggest taking a cab from the station at night. The hotel is few blocks from the Piazza de la Repubblica, with shops & other conveniences close by. I had a good pasta meal with wine at the Irish pub on the corner of Via Napoli for less than 18 Euro. Yes, no Irish food there, just the pub atmosphere & good Italian fare.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience and Service in Rome”
Reviews.Author: cindybelm
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my family June 7-9, 2006. The rooms weren't very large but the hotel is in a good location. We were one block off the Via Nazionale- convenient to the Metro and buses. The rooms were a little small but ours had a balcony. On nice days you can sit out and enjoy The breakfast was very good and the service also was good. The staff was accommodating. They were nice enough to hold some clothes I had left in the room, until we returned a few days later.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Msjaguar
Reviews.Content: Great Place to stay within 5 min. of train station. The hotel is sound proofed and on a quiet street. Though rooms aren't huge they're adequate with marble bathrooms complete with fishbowl. Breakfast was excellent including hot food. They even give turndown service with candy. The hotel is clean and staff very helpful. Don't look anywhere else this is perfect and the price is right, though cheaper through expedia, then their website.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel! We walked in as weary travelers and they gave us juice and cookies. The room was smaller then I expected but it was quaint, they even have fish in the bathroom for a pet during your stay. The staff was multi-lingual and you can't beat the location...we walked everywhere from the hotel.
